Reviews.Title: “Just glorious”
Reviews.Author: Rachel B
Reviews.Content: Can't fault this hotel really. The hotel itself is stunning, romantic and positioned in a quant and quiet end of town. The staff were amazing and so was the breakfast. We forgot a few items in the room including a yoga mat which they happily posted back to us!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrRWade
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful boutique hotel in a fantastic location

Reviews.Title: “Boutique at it's best away from the crowds in Venice”
Reviews.Author: LADYRAWDON
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by a charming receptionist and settled in the lounge with a glass of prosecco and sweet biscuits, whilst our bags were taken to our room. No fuss, no hassle.The small discreet lounge soothes you after the turmoil of travel and the prosecco slips down putting you in the romantic mood for both Venice and this excellent hotel. Our deluxe bedroom was excellent, I loved the dressing room, it also had a small lounge,seating area, with two minibars which contained water and juices inclusive of the room rate, a real bonus.The bath room was compact but had a great powerful shower.The bed was huge and comfortable with loads of lovely pillows,super crisp white linen and at night time outside shutters excluded the world and the light, making for complete peace and quiet. The breakfasts were a revelation, any time between 0730 and 12 noon! in any location in the hotel including delivered to your room!We had all three breakfasts in our room , because the service was spot on and the food fantastic and it made for a flexible start to the day.The breakfasts had everything you could wish for on the menu, fresh squeezed juices,fantastic coffee , omlettes, eggs and bacon, croissants, jams and three choices of honey! and all delivered with charm but no ceremony! Overall this hotel is perfect for lovers, romantics and those that expect discreet , excellent service. I can not tell you how great this hotel really is? I have stayed at 7 other hotels in Venice and unless you want to go top end ie Cipriani then this is as good as it gets!

Reviews.Title: “Sexy and peaceful - perfect for a romantic getaway in Venice”
Reviews.Author: custard2979
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel on Valentine's weekend and at check-in were greeted with a little gift which was incredibly sweet and a perfect start to our break. We were then ushered to the 'sala guigi' on the next floor up and given a welcome Prosecco (always welcome!) and some snacks. Our room was on the top floor and there are no lifts but we were helped with our baggage and then shown the room and it's workings. Our room was suite 336. It was decorated in muted neutral tones with dark wood furniture and the linens and fixtures were of excellent quality. The bath was at the foot of the bed which may seem odd to some people - but try it - it was the deepest, most comfortable bath I've ever been in. With bubbles from the high-end toiletries and a glass of wine you will soon relax! The hotel is small - boutique - and is beautifully decorated. There are furnishings / influences from all around the world; all very evident in the small lounge and terrace. It doesn't have a huge variety of facilities/services but what they do have is excellent. The hotel location is also another bonus. It is situated right next to one of the the most recognisable landmarks of Venice - Salute's church and is diagonally opposite St Mark's Square. In spite of that, the area was incredibly quiet and the walk to the Guggenheim collection and the Rialto bridge was a pleasure. (Particularly in the evening when the fog rolled in and the yellow street lights created a very intimate and romantic atmosphere.) The Dorsudoro island is perfect for art and architecture lovers - or just regular lovers!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jimbo56Manchester
Reviews.Content: Visited for 3 nights in February. This really is a great hotel. To set the record straight (based on review posted Jan 2012) ,the reception staff are fantastic and do perform concierge duties perfectly. Dont forget this is a relatively small sophisticated hotel , not part of a big chain. the long weekend started brilliantly with a limo/private boat transfer right to the steps of the hotel. This was very pricey but if you are going for a special occasion it is an unbeatable way to arrive in one of the prettiest cities in the world. The location is fabulous, across the Grand Canal and one stop on the Vaporetto from St. Marks Sq. The area (Dosoduro) is very atmospheric and whilst it is easy to find bars and restaurants ,wandering around at night you will come across very few people. This is an ancient building and the rooms are all different with great character.The breakfast room overlooking the canal is gorgeous ,and once again the staff are unbeatable. Many thanks to all at Ca Maria Adele

Reviews.Title: “A charmer that Is good but could be great”
Reviews.Author: Kay677
Reviews.Content: The serene quiet location of the hotel is lovely, at the tip of the Dorsoduro, close to the vaporetto and within pleasant walking distance of the Accademia bridge. Overall the hotel is charming, comfortable and recommended. The review is written as the hotel, which is very good, could be great. Some tweaks are needed to earn the ratings and rates. The concierge assistance is inconsistent and weak, with little knowledge shared on restaurants and events, and little tailored to preferences of guests. The desk operates more as a friendly reception but not as a concierge. Little annoyances, including stiff towels, frayed unchanged bath robe, plastic wrapped cups in the bathroom, dirty cloth hand rail, again don't fit with a "luxury" rating. Similarly, complementary touches such as flowers or chocolates in the rooms, or complimentary evening tea or a drink, are missing at this hotel. Given the lack of an on-site bar, or restaurant, the room service menu could be expanded. The common seating area in the winter, when the small terrace is too cold, is also limited. This is a hotel you want to love and return to, yet the owners/management need to get more involved to ensure an overall quality experience and atmosphere for guests (beyond the stylish decor) and to stay on top of improvements that warrant a "luxury" boutique rating, including concierge services. Nged

Reviews.Title: “Our second visit - and still love it!”
Reviews.Author: Iwasthere07
Reviews.Content: We stayed in October for our first anniversary, having previously stayed for our honeymoon. It is a truly wonderful hotel and such a relaxing atmosphere. The staff are are very professional at all times. They arranged trips for us and recommended very good restaurants. There is also an asian guy who works in the evenings bringing room service. He is a credit to the hotel - very professional, friendly, smiley and hard working. (Sorry, I don't recall his name). Nothing was too much trouble for him. The rooms are all beautiful. We stayed in a suite which was just lovely, and it's great to have the extra space and small private terrace outside. The mini bar has complementary soft drinks in it which is a nice touch. We will be back again in 2012 for our second anniversary. It has become a very special place for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service--felt like a queen!”
Reviews.Author: Cat M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went here for part of our honeymoon trip to Italy. I cannot explain how wonderful their service was. Every minor detail was attended to, with the utmost professionalism and care. Anything we needed we were given without asking. A fabulous hotel, very quaint and familiar in the heart of a beautiful area in Venice. A walking distance to San Marco square, with views of the beautiful church from your window. Stunning, excellent hotel with exceptional charm!

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: s782010
Reviews.Content: Very nice boutique hotel in a nice location, next to the Salute church and the Guggenheim museum. Staff were quite reserved, but polite. We stayed in suite 339 and had our own rooftop terrace where we could have breakfast in the morning.The breakfasts were out of this world, over order you wont regret it! The room also had a seperate lounge room/study, and the bedroom was stylish and comfortable. AC was great in the August heat. One thing to mention for anyone arriving late at night is that the vaparetto does not stop at the Salute stop outside the hotel late evening. We had a stuggle figuring out how to get to the hotel after arriving in Venice around midnight due to train delays. We eventually figured out that we had to take the night line and get off at the Accademia, from there the hotel was a short walk away following a back street which runs behind the Guggenheim, taking you out to the Salute and the hotel next to it. Wish we had known this in advance, as is never great when you are caught unprepared while you are tired and stressed and this wasnt noted on the hotel website. We were relieved to arrive at the hotel, and destressed quickly once checked in and enjoying our gorgeous room. The hotel does not have a restaurant, and only serve breakfast and room service snacks, but we found some nice places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: cottageDubai_UAE
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located being just across the canal from St Marks Sq. It is very clean well managed and the staff are extremely friendly. Small draw backs of the hotel is that it does not have a dining area and there isn't any tea or coffee making facilities in the room. Small items which will not detract from the great Venitian experience.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, Simply Superb!”
Reviews.Author: juliawhite
Reviews.Content: After spending 5 blissful days at this hotel I really cannot praise it enough. Ca Maria Adele was a cool, tranquil oasis of calm in the hot bustling city of Venice. We stayed in room 116( Doge Concept Room) which we loved. Happily (after reading other reviews) only a small flight of stairs but I really dont think I would have been too troubled because the overall ambience was so perfect. From the moment of our arrival everyone was warm and welcoming. We took our breakfasts (ordered the night before) in the breakfast room but you could be served in your room, the roof terrace or lounge. The free soft drink mini bar in our room and the daily fresh fruit were a lovely touch. Superb range of toiletries. Very good hairdyer. Slippers and bathrobe supplied plus what could be better after pounding the streets of Venice for hours that relaxing your jacuzzi bath. Whilst i am aware we all view experiences differently- just look at the overall ratings for this gorgeous hotel. You really cant go wrong! P.S.Best of all our flight back to the UK was at 11.30 pm and the very kind hotel let us check out at 6pm.

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: humbug31
Reviews.Content: From the minute the taxi picked us up ( hotel arranged) and dropped us off at the water taxi, the most wonderful adventure began. Upon arrival at our hotel, we were greeted warmly, offered a lovely drink in the sitting area. We chose a regular room ( not a themed room) Ours looked right at the salute, quite wonderful, and very quite at night. Area (dorsodruo) is the best area to stay. Away from all the crowds, but very short wake to everything. Be ware you will have to climb stairs to get to rooms,but keeps you in shape and you do not feel guitly in tasting all what Venice has to offer. Next time bAck to Venice, this hotel will be home again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: terrimm
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, fun, amazing location. Great staff, wonderful food and service. Spring for the water taxi from the airport - you'll be glad you did! Fair warning: if you read the older reviews, you may find that "ground floor" rooms are problematic. If you go, be prepared for an adventuresome flight of stairs. It's part of the package. If this is not for you, choose another hotel. A porter helped us with our bags; the climb to the room was steep and not always welcome after a long day exploring Venice on foot ... but I would happily go back to this hotel. With a vaporetto pass, any part of Venice is easily accessible, yet the serenity of the quiet picturesque neighborhood was most welcome.

Reviews.Title: “you couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: markpattrick
Reviews.Content: A perfect romantic getaway in a beautiful city. From the complimentary glass of prosecco to the option of breakfast in your room or on the terrace, to the wonderful service and the beautifully decorated rooms we couldn't have wished for more. We look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and over-priced.”
Reviews.Author: Michelle9406
Reviews.Content: I had really hoped for a very special stay here, but it did not live up to my expectations. The room, up a lot of steep stairs, was nothing special. Also, as you opened the door, there were 4 or 5 steps that immediately went down into the room from the entrance. A horrible accident just waiting to happen, especially at night before you'd have time to put on the lights. Nasty. 'Welcome' drink was a bit tacky, served in the dark and somewhat dank 'lounge' and we were not told about any extra services, such as the honesty bar, which I've read about on this site since. TV only had a couple of local channels. Annoying opera piped onto the terrace at all times - this would be fine if you had the choice to turn it off if you wanted, but not to be forced to listen to it. Staff were 'cordial' but did not do anything in particular to make the stay great. In fact, when we asked for directions to a particular restaurant on our first night, we were almost given 'the brush-off', and made to feel as though we were very stupid for not automatically knowing the names and pronunciations of certain locations en route. When we asked for name of a particular 'campo' to be written down, we were told, 'Oh, I don't need to. Everyone knows it. Just ask someone!. Anyway, it's going to take you a minimum of 25 minutes to walk there. It's a long way from here.' We had asked the hotel to book the restaurant long before our arrival date, so you would expect that this might have been mentioned beforehand, not just as we were setting out and it was starting to get dark. So, overall, a big let-down. When I am paying over 400 euro per night, I expect top service and luxury. Neither of these were delivered. Oh, and the hotel needs to 'refresh' its habit of serving the same unappetizing nuts (walnuts, etc) every time you get room-service.

Reviews.Title: “Very romantic”
Reviews.Author: rickud
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best deals in Venice. The price is a little high, but well worth it. This boutique hotel is in a relatively quite spot and still only a stop or 2 from San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alia35
Reviews.Content: Have just enjoyed a wonderful weekend break in this gorgeous hotel. We were given a Jacuzzi suite on the third floor which was clean, beautifuly decorated in gold damask fabrics, with a huge 6ft bed and fluffy dressing gowns. Ladies don't bring a hair dryer there is a decent one in the room. Also supplied are Toiletries and other mini essentials and a free safe. Hotel decor is truly beautiful with all the public rooms having so much attention to detail. On arrival we were asked to wait in the lounge and were given complimentary Prosseco which was most welcoming after our travelling. On both mornings of our stay we had breakfast in our room (note over order you dont get enough!) oh and the fresh orange is lovely and freshly squeezed. After 10pm the hotel runs a honesty bar where you help yourself and write down what you had against your room number. We thought this was a wonderful touch. Staff were helpful and friendly and were never intrusive. Location is directly on a water boat stop of "salute" so just purchase a boat ticket to use on the boats for your whole duration and the fact your not directly staying at st marks or rialto will not matter. Would we return "YES YES YES!!" only next time in the warmer months so we can enjoy the outside terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Anticipation was greater than actualization.”
Reviews.Author: GeoWashington
Reviews.Content: As I've preambled for all my prior reviews... I realize these things are not very important in the cosmic scheme of things... but since you asked... I booked via emails with the hotel... and had VERY high hopes for a wonderful room as described and shown on their website. I read many positive reviews as well. The Reservations Staff was VERY accomodating and friendly by email (a theme that continued with ALL of the caring staff throughout our stay). Beautiful and clever decorating of the small but warm and comfortable public spaces. Fine breakfast served, at our choice, either in our room, the 2nd floor breakfast salon or a sitting room in the lobby. There were two significant problems, however. We were booked and confirmed in the "Fireplace Room" that we requested. They even offered me a nice discount (which I took advantage of) for paying in cash. Just days before our departure for Venice the hotel advised us, by email, that "we had many troubles and problems with our booking engine" and that our promised room was not available. They offered an alternative at the same price or a suite for the same price. We accepted the offer of the suite. Upon arrival we learned that the suite was at the top of the hotel, on the 3rd floor (our originally promised room was on the ground floor at canal level). These were VERY high floors (not the traditional 10 ft. stair-length per floor in the States) narrow and with small steps. I have a physical disability that made this Mt. Everest-like everytime. My extremely healthy and exercise-fit wife would also reach the room huffing and puffing. It really colored every trip to and from the room. A second problem... the hotel promised WiFi throughout. It was broken on the 3rd floor. Every, single day, for six days, the reception deskman told me "Today it will be fixed. He is coming today to fix it." Everyday the promise was broken. It was fixed the afternoon before we left Venice. This was problematic in that my vocation requires that I maintain contact through email and my business website at various hours throughout each day... and I couldn't. So... IF the room we were originally promised and that we booked and that was confirmed would have been given to us on the ground floor... and IF the WiFi had worked as promised... I'd be telling you that this was the best boutique hotel experience we've ever had. But it wasn't and it didn't and I can't. Sigh.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Small Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HYNsDad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ca Maria Adele for 3 nights in late January. We chose to come at this time of the year, to avoid the heavy tourist traffic. It worked out fine, as we felt there were more Venetians around then tourists. The Maria Adele was a perfect choice, as its location next to the Salute church is relatively quiet but only a single Vaporetto stop from the St Marco square, on the opposite side of the Grand Canal. The hotel itself is lovely, nicely decorated and well maintained. The small staff was cordial, but did not go out of its way to help. The Maria Adele offers little more than the rooms, and during our stay, even the wireless internet service wasnâ€™t working. They serve a nice breakfast that has to be ordered the night before. We stayed in one of the five â€œthemeâ€� rooms, which was nicely decorated with a few â€œAsianâ€� style pieces of furniture. Not sure if it worth the extra cost. For an off-season charge, at 300+ Euro per night (including breakfast) the Ca Maria Adele is no bargain, but is a lovely choice for quieter comfortable experience, a short hop from the main attractions of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “doesn't get any better for a romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: PepitoD
Reviews.Content: I've travelled recently to Venice and stayed at Ca Maria Adele. This is a small boutique hotel that has the perfect location (there is a Vaporetto stop less then 100 meters away and it takes 5 minutes to walk to the Accademia), has the glamour of a private house and the service of a 5 star boutique hotel. We have stayed in a suite, after being upgraded from the chosen room. The room was very, very charming with a in-room bathtub included. We've travelled from the airport by water taxi (recommended - 25 minutes trip for 90 euros each way - beware the hotel offers the same service for twice the price!!) straight to the hotel door - this a real plus that you wil appreciate when seeing guest from other hotels dragging their heavy luggage through the city, before getting to their hotels. Once arrived at the hotel, we were asked to wait for a few minutes as the reception was checking if our room was ready. As we were waiting, we were served a superb hot chocolate and butter cookies - great way to be welcomed. The morning after we opted to have our breakfast at the breakfast room. A very nice room, plenty of light, where we were served the breakfast we had chosen the night before. the quality, the quantity and the personal care you see that is put on your meal shows the kind of service you can only see at the best places. We truly recommend this hotel to couples (no kids - they'll feel bored and the place has no attraction for them)

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tatiana71Moscow
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in this wonderful hotle twice already. last time I sent my mom for her 65th birthday with my 2 oldest kids (21+13 y.o.). They had absolutely great time!Thanks so much to all of the stuff and the 2guys on reception especially.Actually as well for the chef and the people who prepare wonderful breakfasts at this hotel. They stayed there December 3-6, 2010.We actually live in Moscow, Iam Russian and my husband is American, but the one who lives abroad for 18 years.We travel a lot and I mean a lot, so we stayed in diferent places and I definitely recommend this hotel. we just came back from the US and my daughter tried to order yogurt parfait for breakfast as she couldnt stop longing for the one she had in Ca Maria Adele....well, sorry, Americans, dont know how to make eatable yogurt...Anyhow, Ca Maria Adele is excellent and we will come again. Tatiana Hayes, Moscow

Reviews.Title: “One of my best hotel experiences ever”
Reviews.Author: MrsLampe
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a great weekend in Venice, and stayed at this lovely small hotel (12 rooms only), the location was great just outside the stop of "salute" by the grand canal. The service level of this hotel passed all my expectations, and the staff did everything to make us happy. The breakfast was great and you could choose to have it served either in your room, by the terrace or in the breakfast room, we filled out what we wanted from the menu the night before and thei serve it from 7 till 12..delishes! Would reccomend to book a long time in advance!! Mrs and Mr L.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: w83
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time I have visited this hotel and it was just as fantastic as the last time I stayed a couple of years ago !!! great hotel, great service, good breakfasts and great location !! what more can I say. Except I hope to return, I have been to Venice 3 times now, and I always leave wanting to return again and again !!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonerful Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravellingSusan
Reviews.Content: Very nice room with a great view. The front desk was very helpful and the vaporetto stop was very close by. It was about 10 minutes from San Marco's by vaporetto and was nice to come back at the end of the day to a bit quieter area. Breakfast was good as you ordered the night before and were served in a beautiful breakfast room, beds very good once we asked for a foam top as they were a bit hard. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Life is experience”
Reviews.Author: Journeyur
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay, good location, though right next to a church with bells (but what isn't next to a church), didn't bother us but did they ring on the occasion, the loudest at noon. location was comfortable to getting to sites in Venice, walkable, or short gondola ride across to the island with San Marco, easy to get around and return to. It has a water entrance, so if you're parking your car in the parking lot and have some sizable luggage I would recommend a water taxi and tell them the hotel, they will transport you and your luggage right to the entrance of the hotel and you can avoid lugging you and your luggage through the streets of Venice. we had the 'red' room suite, which was a Venetian experience, the chandelier while not to my personal taste is a construct to behold, excepting for the redness was comfortable, though won't recommend for anyone with allergies as the whole room is covered with fabric and carpet. Also be prepared for the jacuzzi with a shower hose and not enclosed, so if you like showers while it did work fine may not be right for everyone, but if you like baths it would be very enjoyable, beautiful bathroom, roomy for Venice but not conventional, but then it's supposed to be an 'experience'. So while I probably wouldn't stay in the 'red suite' again I would stay at this hotel again. Also service was friendly and helpful, Though we did have to ask for our passports back upon check-in, my understanding with the passports as we travelled through Italy is that the hotels need to type in the information from your passport, but that does not give them the right to keep them. Being aware of the value of my passport and the pain to replace it in the event of a mishap, I always ask for it to be returned and prefer to wait while they type in the information, personal preference. Also free wifi available for guests with good connection speeds.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking beauty and faultless service - utter luxury”
Reviews.Author: cheapmuesli
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Sala Noir in this spectacular boutique hotel adjacent to Salute in Dorsoduro. The web site looked good, but was unable to prepare us for the drama and theatre of our room. Over-the-top fabrics, lighting, furniture and accessories and a spotless luxury bathroom equipped with a state-of-the-art shower. Glamorous desk staff helped us with all our queries with efficiency and courtesy. A refreshing dry martini on arrival proved an excellent choice and breakfast in our room, with a glass of prosecco was unbeatable. Why stay anywhere else?

Reviews.Title: “A calm oasis”
Reviews.Author: hillcrestroad
Reviews.Content: Our only break in 3 years, so we really needed this to be special -- and it was. This is a lovely hotel, away from the constant buzz, but easy to walk to and from. A vaporetto stop is 75 m away, but the whole city is very walkable. We liked the Dorsoduro area, and returned there at night to stroll along the canals to find a quiet restaurant, many only 10 mins from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: lvmv29
Reviews.Content: My husband went to Lido on business and decided to stay in Venice the last 2 nights. A colleague of his chose the hotel and although I was a little worried about the selection, as soon as I arrived( even after traveling for 21 hours) I loved the hotel, location and room. Dorsoduro is a very convenient quiet area, with great restaurants and very accessible to the noisy, touristy area near Piazza San Marcos and Rialto ( probably a 15-20 min walk). The hotel is next to a Vaporetto stop and has it's own water taxi dock. The room was very spacious, comfortable and nicely decorated( not the usual stuffy venetian style). The soda, water and juice in the minibar was included in the room rate, which although slightly expensive, was reasonable. The breakfast selection was extensive and great quality. The staff was very attentive and their restaurant recommendations were excellent. Although lacking a fitness facility, it is next to a "sidewalk " next to the Grand Canal where you can jog or walk. Overall I was impressed and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel with themed rooms”
Reviews.Author: lunajia
Reviews.Content: I loved staying here during carnival season because the themed hotel rooms added to the creativity of the season. The service is good and in terms of location it could have been better. The hotel is a boat ride away from Piazza San Marco and the boat will pick you up almost in front of the hotel. Each one of my friends stayed in a different themed room and mine was the oriental room. I loved the decoration and found that my stay there was very pleasurable because of the staff and the room as well.

Reviews.Title: “Oh yes, more of this please”
Reviews.Author: AndrewCrown
Reviews.Content: I was treated to this lovely place as part of my 40th birthday. Classical boutique hotel in a wonderfully quiet part of this divine city. The hotel will sort anything you need. Room was stylish, shower was amazing... All ambience good. We liked the night porter, he was charming and helpful. (The older chap). Other staff were charming too, when we hired a self drive motor boat (which you can do here if you look), they happily supplied ice buckets and glasses for our bellini picnic. I hesitate to mention the downside, but I must. It was hot in Venice 24C..(for us northern hemisphere people). and the hotel had not yet decided to switch on the air conditioning, nor would they when asked, we didn't like that bit. If you choose this place you will be very happy indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel, but poor value for money!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalVillage_09
Reviews.Content: Surprised my husband during our 1 year anniversary celebrations by taking him there for a weekend break. What we enjoyed about the hotel: â€¢ It was a small boutique hotel that had a funky and creative style. The interior design of the hotel is fun and different to a number of the older hotels in Venice that felt a little old and outdated. I called the hotel to make the reservation and explain the importance of the event. They were helpful and recommended the â€œorientalâ€� room which was absolutely lovely. â€¢ Hotel and room is perfectly located next to the â€˜Saluteâ€™ boat spot, easy to walk around the surroundings and 1 stop to San Marco. â€¢ If you love seafood, I would recommend that you visit â€˜lineadombraâ€™ which is 2mins from hotel. Absolutely fantastic fresh but ridiculously expensive! What we didnâ€™t enjoy: â€¢ It felt that they charged 5 star prices at 4 star service. Room had been small, but you tend to expect that as Venice is small. Found it incredibly noisy, people talking in the street were heard loud and clear in our room! Tip: take ear plugs. â€¢ The breakfast is my favourite meal when staying in a lovely hotel, and was really disappointed by the quantity and presentation. Tip: over order as it feels like more on paper! â€¢ No iron available but charge â‚¬10-15 per item (approx). Apparently itâ€™s a health and safety issue, but then they charge extortionate amounts for the service! â€¢ P.s. is incredibly expensive !!

Reviews.Title: “A Start to a Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: ke301
Reviews.Content: Paying attention to every detail, this hotel was an experience of its own. The White Room on the bottom floor was spectacular, the room service was top notch, the views from all points of the hotel were nearly fantastical! Breakfast was delicious (though one staff member seemed absolutely miserable with her job) and the always stocked minibar was so refershing during the hot summer days!

Reviews.Title: “A Venice Proposal”
Reviews.Author: triplesowcow
Reviews.Content: Our stay (or should I say experience) with Ca Maria Adele was simply outstanding! I can't think of a single critique! Both my (now) fiance and I had a simply amazing stay. Every touch from the wine and biscuits upon arrival and the personal greeting and handshake of the owner to the simply outstanding quality of service (front desk getting us room service long after the kitchen had closed) and mind-blowingly beautiful (and impeccably clean and maintained) rooms. We stayed in the lavishly decorated "The Doge's Room" (which is at least as impressive as the photos online) and thoroughly enjoyed the delicious a la carte breakfasts every morning (they were some of the best food we had while in Venice). Ca Maria Adele was and is so perfect that it also served as the place where I proposed to my now fiance! Neither of us can recommend this place highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “I will truly remember this place for the rest of my life!”
Reviews.Author: cmsweet79
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel. For starters, its not your typical hotel. Its boutique style and very personal, cozy. When we arrived, I was surprised that they knew my name already. They took all our bags, and set us up with some Prosecco and refreshments as we waited for them to finish our room. The Staff was extremely friendly (they might have been the owners who greeted us, not 100% sure). They recommended activities and a restaurant (Riveria). We were kind of scared a little bit by the restaurant they recommended, which was very small and not overly fancy....however, it turned out to be AMAZING! They hooked us up with many free perks, and prepared basically whatever we could think of (even if it wasn't on the menu). The hotel was also located in a great location. It was away from the hustle and bustle of Saint Marks Square, but close enough to be very convienient. Ca Maria Adele also provides complimentary service to Murano. They have a nice terrace as well, which I ended up proposing to my girlfriend on. AMAZING, AMAZING, AMAZING!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Perfect for a romantic getaway - a real treat.”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowRosie
Reviews.Content: This is a small, but perfectly located exceptional hotel. We spent the first 4 days of our honeymoon in Venice and read the reviews of previous trip advisors prior to booking it. It was exactly as they had described. Ok. If I was being very picky the only point I would make was that the room was quite small but then again we were on honeymoon for 2 weeks and so had quite a lot of luggage with us. If you are going for a city break for a few days it would be an ideal size. This hotel is relaxed but sophisticated and we felt very special staying there. What we liked about it was there was no fuss (from the staff) it was quiet, we could choose our location for breakfast (although the terrace wasn't an option since we arrived in freak cold weather conditions!) The breakfast room was absolutely ideal and the service was first class. We ate there twice without anyone else in the room. If you are planning to travel to Venice and want a beautiful hotel in a perfect (and quiet) location, that is sophisticated and has charm then this is your hotel. It is expensive but that is Venice. One extra point to mention, there are quite a few stairs (not that many - maybe 15/20 but no lift) and so I wouldn't recommend this for people who are not very mobile. Then again, I wouldn't recommend Venice for people who aren't very mobile!

Reviews.Title: “If someone else is paying”
Reviews.Author: iloveaixMelbourne
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel if you aren't paying for it. Our room was small and had a weird electrical noise constantly buzzing in the corner. It's location is brilliant and the breakfast is nothing short of amazing... Best we have ever had delivered to your room. Everything fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: SibeNut
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Doges Room for 3 nights to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Absolutely fabulous experience and impeccable service. The hotel is in a quiet section of Venice which is a plus. I highly recommend ordering a Prosecco to be served on the terrace in late evening for a romantic setting.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, fine location”
Reviews.Author: Atticus01
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice and the archtecture and views (on what were sunny and clear autumn days) lived up to and surpased our expectations. The hotel is well placed, about 100 yards from the Salute water bus stop (the next stop and on the opposite side of the Grand Canal to St. Marks Sq). The No. 1 bus stops there every 10 mins or less so it is very easy to get around (buy a bus pass at the stop at St Marks or Academia Bridge). The Water buses are brilliant and having the bus pass means you can hop on and off at will. The hotel rooms are absolutey superb (we stayed in the Moorish Room and viewed the Fireplace Room). The former has a bath and the latter a shower, but both have been designed with great attention to detail and are of fine quality with wonderful furnishings. If on your first visit the only way to arrive is by water taxi fom the airport to the canal entrance of the hotel, and the fixed pice is Euro 95. If you are not in a hurry the water bus back to the airport fom St Marks is Euro 13 pp and takes about an hr and 15 mins. Hotel staff are courteous and very helpful. On a broader note, be aware that Venice is VERY expensive, two glasses of house wine at an unexeptional bar/restaurant were Euro 18 and at a rate of one Euro to the Â£ that seems pricey, but then it is VENICE. Perhaps because it was the end of the season, the local Italians seemed fed up of the tourists and they find it hard to smile or be helpful other than when trying to charm you into their restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cosy but erratic service”
Reviews.Author: Alexandre92100
Reviews.Content: Very nice place. Stayed there 3 nights. The location is good but completely dead at night...so it's calm! Nice staff but service is so-so (I've asked for some more soap in the bathroom....I'm still waiting for it) Was in the "sala noire", very nice setting. Be carefull, this hotel as no elevator and there are steps everywhere! but after one day in Venice, you'll get used to steps....wether you like it or not!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem - small pot of gold away from the crowds in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ClaireRising
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very small and boutique. It is very reserved and quiet and you feel as though you are staying at someone's very classy apartment. The decor is opulent and spectacular. The rooms are sensational, rich colours, velvets, baroque design - pure luxury. If you have never been to Venice before and don't want am enormous touristy hotel (this is ideal for a romantic weekend away, or engagement or anniversary event), then book this.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous welcome and stylish oasis in a brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: jasmine78London
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at this beautiful little hotel from the minute we arrived by boat at the private launch. As everyone else has said, the staff are just wonderful, supremely charming and helpful - we asked for a late checkout on our final day and they let us stay in the room til 6pm with no extra charge... This was just one example of how welcoming and generous they were. The decor in the public areas is perfect for venice very charmingly done - our room was clean and smart and not too chintzy (which can be a problem in venice) but could perhaps have had a little more of a 'design' feel like some of the suites. We did however have a great view of the grand canal (you need to ask in advance if you want the room with the view of the grand canal as there's only one... !) The breakfast terrace is a bit cramped - we coincided with 2 other couples and it felt a little bit awkward. We preferred taking breakfast in the room. The location is fantastic - it's lovely to be able to walk to the Gugg and on from there to the Academia... however, there is a lack of nice lunch places in the neighbourhood (but then the food in Venice is a bit lacking in general...) Overall, REALLY recommend this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for honeymooners!”
Reviews.Author: VMLOxford
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, Staff friendly and very helpful but not overbearing. Hotel nicely located for the main sites of Venice. Don't forget to use the Gondala ferry! Rooms excellent. Breakfast is pre-ordered for the time and location (!) that you want.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: VikingThomas
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by stating that I have stayed in some of the worlds best hotels, including The Waldorf astoria in New York, but this hotel and its staff were by far the best by far! The Ca Maria Adele did its best, and succeeded, at giving my wife and I an incredibly romantic and wonderful stay in the city of Venice. We arrived on a Tuesday, first week of August, and was greeted with a private car which picked us up at the airport followed by a private boat which took us to Ca Maria Adele where the pampering begang. We were greeted by a friendly staff and our bags were taken to our room while we enjoyed homemade icecream and some beverages on this hot day. Just perfect start and we almost licked the bowl clean, ha ha. We were then taken to a delux room, which was very nice, but being the attentive husband that I am I noticed that my wife was hoping for a bathtub so I leaped into action. As my wife was unpacking I excused myself and said I needed to check on some reservations for dinner and went down and talked to one of the extremely helpful men at the reception. I asked if they has any other room and I was offered, for a small charge in my eyes, an upgrade to THE SUITE with a private BALCONY...and a BATHTUB :D I ofcourse accepted and I arranged to take my wife out on some shopping while the staff moved all of our bags to the suite so my wife would be surprised. It all went according to plan and after som shopping my wife and I were lead to our suite which was just breath-taking. Like I mentioned it has a private terrasse where we were served breakfast every morning, a seperate living room where we could unwind and enjoy a bottle of prosecco, 2 fridges stocked with softdrinks and water, a large bedroom, an entrance way....bathroom with a bath....etc etc. Just absolutely gorgeous. The hotel is located at the perfect spot in Veniza. The Vaporetto (large boat which takes you around town) is literaly 2 mins away. The hotel can also arrange for a private water-taxi or gondola if you so chose. The Hotel also made some wonderful suggestions as to where to eat, and the Linea D'umbro on the water by the Hotel was just amazing. We ate there......4 times!!!! We just couldnt help ourselves. They prepared grilled king prawns for us to start, then homemade pasta with lobster in a light sauce....they also had the best seafood soup I have ever tasted ( I am looooove to eat, ha ha). Perfect service and the best food. Do note that this restaurant is a bit expensive, but for 30% more you get 100% better food than the typical tourist spots. To finish let me just say that my wife and I are already planning our next stay at the Ca Maria Adele. I can not express to you the high level of quality as it related to the breakfast, the service, the rooms....and so on and so on. Do yourself a favor and stay here, it is by far the most wonderful stay my wife and I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “supberb hotel in best location with unique service”
Reviews.Author: Ballner
Reviews.Content: This is a great hideaway in busy Venice. Perfect location, just across San Marco, easy access by public transportation. Very nice rooms, quiet during the night. Great service! Mr. Gabriele, many thanks for a relaxing stay! We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic duvet of a hotel -- 56 tog!”
Reviews.Author: Foggy4Colchester
Reviews.Content: If this hotel was a duvet .. it would be 56 tog ! Wrapping itself around you with genteel warmth and romanticism, culture and sophistication. Over the top? .. no way. Enjoy the feeling of being smothered by the very fabric of the hotel itself ,beautifully designed to welcome you and take you into another world. The live web cam in your room showing the busy lagoon opposite the hotel means you can truly do what this hotel helps you do best .... relax and watch the world go by. The staff were lovely,friendly,informative,extremely smart and know exactly what their business is about.They can compete with the better know hotels on all levels - 5 star service expected (at these prices !) .. 7 STAR achieved. A lovely,lovely experience. This was our second honeymoon - I think we might plan a 3rd , then a 4 th , then ....

Reviews.Title: “Divine romantic perfection”
Reviews.Author: raindiva
Reviews.Content: My review is a bit late, but have been thinking about Venice lately. If you are searching for the perfect Venetian boutique hotel, search no more! I am extremely picky and have been known to change hotel rooms 3 times in one visit. I found absolutely nothing wrong with the hotel. We stayed in the Doges Suite (over-the-top in a good way). Breakfasts were unbelievable (every night they leave a card in your room and you get to check off what you want for breakfast....prosecco anyone?) And the location on a darling little canal in the Dorsoduro neighborhood was away from the crowds but still close enough. Some day I'll be back in Venice and I will absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly Amazing”
Reviews.Author: roby151
Reviews.Content: We went to the Ca Maria Adele for a relaxing long weekend. It was by far one of the best hotel stays we have ever had in Europe. From the second we arrived via Gondola, there were drinks and light snacks presented to us in a beautiful reception room. Our suite was so clean and decorated perfectly, not over the top ornate, but enough to feel like we were in Venice. Had a great rooftop deck with great views of Venice. Breakfast was delish, and staff couldnt have been better. I highly reccomend to all if you are looking for romance and relaxation. We will def be back.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: RaeSam3
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel!! Gave it a 3 for location only because of the long walk to the most popular areas, but the beauty of the hotel outweighs any walk! While checking in you are taken to a beautiful area for a welcome drink, the entire time you will be talking about how amazing this hotel is before you even see a room!!! We were guided to our room, although it had a sewer smell to it, we were excited to see the view of the church and got used to the scent. Breakfast took us by surprise, a card is given to fill out, I thought typical American breakfast; OMG, it was everything you ask for and beyond!!! Okay, I will admit, the housekeeper/breakfastngirl was annoying; she giggled EVERY time we saw her!! Was it because we got the stinky room? Overall, a fantastic place to stay; we were torn, sight seeing or laying around in the room!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: DIZZYDOLLYDAYDREAM
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay here, but we like the look of it so much when we stumbled accross it during an evening stroll, we called in for a brochure. It is set in a very pretty setting, if i went back to Venice, i would like to stay here. But , that said, if it is just outside your budget, have a look at the Splenid Venice starhotel, we did stay there, and it was just fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “elegant, charming ca maria adele”
Reviews.Author: hightideorlowtide
Reviews.Content: This really is a very charming and very chic small hotel. On arrival a chilled glass of prosecco - just perfect, lovely location overlooking a pretty canal with the Grand canal also in view, tucked nicely away from the action but a sensible walk away from St Mark's square and only a couple of minutes via the water bus if you prefer. Breakfast is a delight - brought to room every morning at specified time with anything from muesli to omlettes, bacon, cheeses ham - juices / coffees etc. Ideal for those looking for an intimate set up with emphasis on stylish surroundings would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, small, boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: censington
Reviews.Content: The decoration and design is excellent, as are the staff. The roof terrace, lounge and breakfast room have real distinction. The public areas are small. There is a simple lunch menu that they don't publicise and which you can eat in the breakfast room or roof terrace. The location is excellent and on the edge of one of the best areas of Venice and is well removed from the tourist hordes. The room was less distinct than the public areas but that is not to complaint. In many other hotels it would be excellent. It is expensive for it's size and services though, but I'm still very glad I stayed there. Don't pre book their river taxi from the airport: it is too expensive and a far more complex arrangement than simply getting a private water taxi at the airport on arrival. This is an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hidden gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: MonicaW_8
Reviews.Content: We returned last night from a few days in Venice and it was amazing, especially thanks to our stay at the Ca'Maria Adele. The hotel is gorgeous, staff very friendly and our room 321 was amazing, so luxurious and quirky! Great turndown gifts and lovely notes every day. Breakfast was excellent in a lovely breakfast room and super service by lovely young lady. I loved the location so close to the boat stops and also because its slightly hidden in a nice quiet area and away from the very busy tourist bits, really an excellent location! Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “A gem - making such a special first stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Tonyski
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel in Mr and Mrs Smith. It ived up to all expectations, with a quiet location, friendly, helpful staff, and a fantastic roon (the Doge's room). Breakfast a real treat. We'll come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Splendour”
Reviews.Author: OxfordRicky
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to Venice and this hotel was highly recommended by a number of places and we were not disappointed. Our themed room was spacious and luxuriously furnished with a window overlooking the Grand Canal. All areas were spotlessly clean and decorated to a high standard. The breakfast room was small but luxurious with a good choice of food. There is no bar in the hotel but there is a small lounge area where you can sit and relax and enjoy a drink if you did not want to go back to your room. The staff were friendly and helpful advising us of places to visit and eat, they will arrange Gondola rides for you and water taxis back to the airport. Whilst waiting for the water taxi they were kind enough to provide us with a complimentary drink. The hotel is expensive but not much in Venice isnâ€™t. Being across the canal from St Mark Square was an advantage however as the places to eat this side of the canal were not as expensive as the other side.

Reviews.Title: “Venetian Dream”
Reviews.Author: diesahne
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to review this hotel ever since returning from a magical stay there in the summer of 2007. My boyfriend and I stayed in one of the two suites on the upper floor. Ca' Maria Adele is everything one would wish for in a Venetian vacation -- exquisitely romantic and aesthetically exotic, with extremely courteous and professional service and reasonable rates. On a practical level, the location is convenient and the rooms comfortable -- but what lingers is the ineffable beauty of the atmosphere painstakingly created by the owners of the hotel. I still remember vividly leaving the hotel on a glorious summer morning in a gondola from its private dock -- with the sun shimmering in the sky and reflecting on the aquamarine waters of the Venetian lagoon -- with one of the (handsome!) managers of the hotel personally seeing me and my boyfriend off. Almost two years later and back in more sobering reality, we still dream of Ca' Maria Adele.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect start to a perfect honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: cadunne
Reviews.Content: Having trawled Trip Advisor for our ideal hotel I came across Ca Maria Adele, how glad I am that I did. We started our honeymoon in Venice with 3 nights stay here and it was perfect. Everything from the welcome drinks and snacks, to beer on the roof terrace on a warm evening, the fantastic room (The Fireplace Room), gorgeous breakfast, the personal notes every night, and indeed one that arrived the morning after we returned from Italy. We loved it. Yes it's expensive, for us anyway, but we wouldn't stay anywhere else in Venice now. Go enjoy and savour every moment of peace and tranquility amongst the heat and bustle of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A true Venician Gem”
Reviews.Author: mtjwatts
Reviews.Content: I booked this for a short getaway for my wifes birthday, this truly is a wonderful hotel in a superb location within minutes of the main sites of Venice. The rooms are excellent, ours had a view of Ca Maria Della Salute across the canal and was beautifully decorated. The staff were always willing to help, either by recommending restaurants or places to see, or by making arrangements for you. Its always the little things that really make the difference and here the attention to detail made it for us, from the wine and biscuits when we arrived to the breakfasts brought to the room every morning. Our friends recommended this hotel to us and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it on to other friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Escape”
Reviews.Author: HendleyandBlythe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this great little hotel for 3 nights to celebrate my wife's birthday (minus the kids). Delightfully discreet and luxurious in the most terrific location. Its very close to the grand canal and San Marco but feels pleasantly separate from the tourist throng. We were upgraded on arrival to one of the themed rooms (Chinese) which was beautifully furnished and comfortable. Staff were friendly and attentive but not obtrusive. Quality and choice at breakfast was very good. Definitely one of the best hotels we've stayed in and would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute perfection across the board!”
Reviews.Author: butchertravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a wonderful 3 week trip to Europe. Our trip ended in Beautiful Venice at the Ca Maria Adele situated on the quiet, clean and quaint Dursoduro district just across from San Marco. I cannot say enough good things about this precious boutique hotel. The accommodations are luxurious and elegant in every way. We enjoyed two rooms during our stay. The first three nights we stayed in Suite 336 with the modern jacuzzi bath at the foot of the bed. We stayed in the Oriental themed room on the final night. The rooms were very different but both were simply perfect - large comfortable kind sized beds, cozy linens and well appointed bathrooms. The common areas of the hotel are stunning as well. Everything you would expect from a top-notch resort, hotel or B&B plus more! Ca Maria Adele has set the standard in modern luxury, without going overboard or being pretentious. In addition to the perfect rooms, the service and staff were outstanding. Our every request was met with superb results, whether it was restaurant recommendations, cultural suggestions or simple a great Gelato shop. The staff in particular were extremely impressive. The location is absolutely perfect as well. Away from the crowds, yet close enough to get to any of the main attractions within a few minutes. I highly recommend this area of Venice, opposed to San Marco, which is where you will of course, spend a lot of your time anyway. I can't wait to return to this hidden gem! My husband and I have stayed at many fine hotels, resorts, inns and b&b's around the world. If I was asked to give feedback on the Maria Adele, I simple would give nothing but high marks. It's simply perfect. To top it off, the included breakfast, served everyday in any area of the hotel you wish, is sumptuous, diverse and leaves you feeling extremely satisfied. My hat's off to this beautiful, well run, perfect oasis, in the heart of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Staggeringly Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gosforth_Ultra
Reviews.Content: What a place!! It's difficult to know where to start with Ca Maria Adele - myself and my partner (now wife - this was our honeymoon!) have stayed in many a hotel all over the world and I would have to say that this was the very best. Venice, is of course an astonishing city and the hotel occupies one of the best locations - right next to the Salute church in a lovely, quiet district, far from the madding crowd! The decor inside, including the rooms is beautiful - all very opulent but far removed from the 'chintz' that seems to pre-occupy the thoughts of a few of the city's hotels. The breakfasts each morning were equally brilliant and really set us up for the day but where the hotel really sets itself apart is the service. I won't spoil some of the more 'obvious' touches for guests, other than to say that every request was met in an efficient and friendly manor and the staff really sought to go the extra mile (cliched I know!). The restaurant recommendations they gave to us were first class and I can highly recommend asking for a tip of two as to where to eat and all round we were made to feel really special. For a special occasion (it is a splurge, undoubtedly!) it cannot be beaten - truly memorable place.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect”
Reviews.Author: BillNoble
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is perfect. The rooms, staff, room service, and location couldn't be faulted. This is an intimate hotel in a quiet part of Venice. St Mark's Square is just a few minutes away by Water Bus. There are only two reasons not to stay at Ca Maria Adele that I can think of: (1) It is expensive, (2) You like large impersonal hotels. Venice is a phenomenally expensive city but of all of our expenses the hotel was by far the best value for money. We stayed in the Fireside room for the first night and loved the lapping of the water just inches below our windows. It was light and airy with a fabulous walk-in shower. For the next two nights we stayed in the Doge's room. Opulent, luscious, deep red walls with a fabulous light and bright en-suite with two massive windows onto the street outside. When we arrived we were given two gigantic glasses of Prosecco and some Venetian biscuits while our room was prepared and the lighting adjusted just so for maximum impact. The hotel was an oasis of calm after hours of walking through the crowded streets of Venice. Of all our meals out the best by far was at the Linea D'Ombra restaurant, which the hotel recommends. We had a drink on the terrace overlooking the canal and then retired inside to the contemporary dining room for the meal. The staff were attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable. The food was very good and I would give it 8/10. It is however impossible to judge the restaurant on value for money because every meal and drink we had was exorbitantly priced. It was at least twice as much as we would normally pay for a meal of that quality (Â£225 for 2 with a single glass of wine each). Surprisingly one of the best cafe drinks we had was in St Mark's Square. Â£9 for a hot chocolate for 1! But the second best hot chocolate I have ever had and it was worth it to watch the snakes of tourists get entangled as they tried to negotiate their way between tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “a fantasic birthday in venice”
Reviews.Author: TJCNewcastleuponTyne
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Ca Maria Adele for a couple of nights recently (minus children). The hotel is beautiful - close to everything (1 minute from Salute vaporetto stop on the Grand Canal, and a short walk from the Zattere) but very peaceful. The Hotel worked out from my passport that it was my birthday, and when we went to breakfast we were met with champagne and fresh berries served on rose petals. They also booked us into a local restaurant that evening, and I was then presented with a candle (and a rendition of "happy birthday") with my pudding. Charming, quietly opulent and thoughtful - an excellent place for a romantic special occasion - will go back. AAC, Newcastle

Reviews.Title: “Venice Apartment”
Reviews.Author: womspir
Reviews.Content: Loved this little apartment in Venice. It was centrally located near the Jewish Ghetto. Complete with air conditioning, TV, kitchen. The refrigerator as well as the pantry were well stocked with goodies. Christian & Lorenzo were very helpful and explained all of the amenities. Christian was especially helpful when there was a rail strike. He came over to provide whatever help we needed. Venice was beautiful even in the heat of summer!

Reviews.Title: “As Charming as Venice Itself”
Reviews.Author: Porpex
Reviews.Content: We were in Venice for a charity function, and decided to forego the grand hotels of Venice like the Gritti and the Bauer and try out this smaller, relatively new boutique place instead, and I'm so very glad that we did. It's away from the occasionally maddening heart of the city, but still conveniently close to all the major tourist destinations. And the place is steeped in charm! The downstairs library is stunningly designed, with overstuffed chairs and whimsical sconces over the fireplace; the terrace where we breakfasted is like a room in a Moorish palace, with giant, overstuffed cushions and ornate tapestry. And the room managed to navigate the line between wildly chic and incredibly comfortable at the same time (and the views from our windows were gorgeous.) The staff was always eager to oblige any request, and the owners even stopped by to inquire if our stay was all we hoped (and brought their sleek black dachsund in tow, who I might have mistaken for another whimsical trinket, were it not for his wagging tail.) The hotel doesn't have its own restaurant, but offers some room service and includes a tasty, handsomely-presented breakfast. For transportation, there's a dock directly on the canal. We'd stay here again and again...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and tranquil in the circus that is Venice”
Reviews.Author: debi.in.london
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the last 2 nights of our long honeymoon in Italy. We paid just over 500 eu total per night for a non-themed room. The room was still beautiful and big, and on the top corner facing the Grand Canal and church which we thought gave us the best view in the place. It was spotless and very comfortable. The bed was wonderful and the bathroom large with a jacuzzi and fantastic view from the shower. The toiletries were some of the best I've used. Breakfast was probably the best we have had anywhere. There is a wide variety and they also made me something that was not on the menu but I had just written down. Everything was delicious. The staff were friendly and accommodating from the second we arrived. The free mini bar was always stocked and there was free wi-fi. Special mention to the older night receptionist, he was lovely. We kept interrupting his cigarette breaks when we came back to the hotel at night, but he was always very friendly and charming. The only bad thing I can say is that I did mention when making the reservation that it was our honeymoon, and there was no acknowledgement of that at all. Venice itself was a bit of a disappointment. Besides it being absolutely beautiful and surreal, we thought that it lacked personality. We had been used to lots of lively Italian cities and towns on this trip and in the past, and found Venice to be a little dull. We went out for dinner one night and arrived at a place that was meant to be lively just before 10pm only to find they were closing the kitchen in 5 minutes and we would have to hurry up and order, and then they had barely anything left and I got stuck with something I didn't want. And this was a Friday night! Walking through the town on the way home was beautiful - but completely empty and silent. We were grateful the hotel was in Dorsoduro - the other side of the canal was a circus. Venice is just full of tacky glass and mask shops, with nothing tasteful in sight. We didn't see many restaurants that looked interesting or didn't cater especially for tourists. The best place we ate was close to the hotel on the corner of the other main canal, the food was great and they were very friendly. Also it was well worth going to the Peggy Guggenheim collection. So all in all a great hotel that made the stay in average Venice more bearable.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, peaceful and classy haven in a unique city.”
Reviews.Author: EllieHope
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 3 night break at Ca Maria Adele. I booked it based largely on reviews on this site, subsequently my expectations were high. I was not disappointed. What I liked : Location - 150 yards away from the Grand Canal, down a quiet smaller canal. The entrance looks directly at the Santa Maria della Salute (the dome is unfortunately covered in scaffolding at the moment, a shame). The hotel is on Dorsodouro, the opposite side of the Grand Canal to San Marco square, but it is one stop across the water on the Vaporetto. Close enough to the main tourist attractions, but far enough away for some peace and quiet. We would go back to the hotel for a cup of tea and 10 mins rest after a few hours sightseeing. Dorsodouro is also full of interesting art galleries and glass and jewellry shops. Room - We stayed in one of the themed rooms, Sala Noir. Beautifully decorated, a king double with a good mattress and pillows, a great bathroom up some stairs from the bedroom, a mini bar that was always filled with free water and soft drinks. A romantic and peaceful and comfortable room. Staff - helpful, polite, cheerful, efficient. They get it just right. Francesco and Gabriele will look after you. Breakfast - huge choice, you order from a card the night before, all beautiful breads / jams / juices / fruit / yoghurts / honey / eggs / parma ham / cheeses etc. And you can have it in the breakfast room / terrace / lounge / your own room. I was going to write down a list of things we didn't like, but I can't think of anything ! I did ask the hotel to book some restaurants for us, and I agree with a previous reviewer who said there is no need at the moment. The recession and strong euro seem to be biting in Venice, and I didn't see a restaurant that was full up at any time. Of the restaurants that were booked, I'd recommend Lineadombra, a short walk from the hotel, with a terrace with great views of the southern venice islands. Also Al Vecio Forner for authentic and simple italian cuisine. One other thing - the water taxi that the hotel booked for me from the airport was expensive - 180 euros - but super efficient and time saving and a great way to start your trip. I would definitely do that again. When I hopefully go back to Venice, I will stay at Ca Maria Adele again.

Reviews.Title: “Magical treat for Venice lovers”
Reviews.Author: flyingscott
Reviews.Content: My wife took me to this hotel for my birthday. Six years ago we spent a week in a great antique apartment on the Grand Canal near the Academia Bridge and feared that this experience could not be surpassed. This hotel exceded it. I have nothing unfavourable to say about this hotel. It was perfect for us, but if you wish a gymn or have children then please look elsewhere. As for Venice we love it, but this time it was very quiet. We note comments on getting the hotel to make reservations but there were tables readily available at all restaurants, and some were deserted. This hotel is expensive but in a magical city it will guarantee a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and very romantic.”
Reviews.Author: KOHG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ca Maria Adele in June 2008 for three nights on our honeymoon. We booked direct with the hotel and requested the Doge's Room. It was fantastic! The room was huge and had every comfort you could think of. The bathroom was also huge and very modern with a large corner jacuzzi bath. The hotel is not cheap but unlike some other hotels you don't feel as though they are squeezing every penny out of you - breakfast is included and the mini bar is free. They are also very quick to restock it - we drank a lot of water while we were there and every time we came back to our room the mini bar had been restocked. The hotel is in an excellent location - just across from St Mark's. It costs 2 Euros to cross the Grand Canal on the Vaporetto and the Vaporetto stop is just 2 minutes from the hotel. Alternatively it's a 5-10 minute walk to the Accademia Bridge to cross to the other side. After the hectic atmosphere of St Mark's it was lovely to be able to cross the canal to the calm of Ca Maria Adele each evening. There aren't many Engligh speaking channels on the TV but there is a DVD player and numerous DVDs available to borrow from reception. Breakfast is lovely although they never quite managed to get it right for us! The first morning they'd forgotten to pick our breakfast card up from our door so we had to wait while they rushed around trying to get our breakfast sorted at the last minute. On the second morning they forgot some of the food we'd ordered. On the third morning we checked out before breakfast was available - we'd asked the night before whether or not we could get a sandwich to take with us to the airport and we were assured there would be some food ready for us when we left, however when we checked out the guy on reception knew nothing about it so we left with just a couple of bananas! Other than that though I cannot fault the hotel or the service and I would definitely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the splurge...”
Reviews.Author: celticmoon
Reviews.Content: Ca Maria Adele is worth the splurge. I cannot add anything that hasn't already been said. Great selections of restaurant which they will recommend and reserve for you. A trip to Murano by water taxi is included in the stay. We stayed in The Oriental Room which is on a smaller canal and is directly across from the Salute church. The staff are helpful and loaned us a laptop for the day. Mini bar is included. Very clean and tidy. Accademia is a 10 - 15 minute walk. Plenty of shops to keep you busy. I would definitely return and stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Room with a Venetian View”
Reviews.Author: DonnyOwl
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice and we booked 4 nights at the Ca' Maria. On arrival, we caught a water taxi from the train station directly to the hotel which has its own private landing stage, a member of staff appeared immediately to help with our baggage which was whisked off to our room while we enjoyed a glass of Prosecco in the lounge. The Ca' Maria has 5 themed rooms and 9 other deluxe rooms. We had asked for a deluxe room which gave the best view, and we weren't disappointed. Room 332 is on the top floor and does give a partial view of the Grand Canal through a side window while front windows look directly on to a small canal which runs in front of the Church Santa Maria della Salute. The room itself was generous in size with a beamed ceiling, plasma tv which provided a webcam of the Grand Canal, free minibar and a very comfortable bed (which was a relief after some of the previous Tripadvisor reviews we had read). The bathroom had both bath and shower and was more than adequate. You are given a choice as to where you take your breakfast (you have to specify the night before). You can have this brought to your room, but we opted to eat either on the sun terrace or in the breakfast room, with our choice depending largely on the weather forecast which the hotel provides for the following day. You can have as much or as little as you like (including more Prosecco!) The staff were, without fail, friendly and helpful. You were given the impression that nothing would be too much trouble. The location of the hotel is truly excellent. Dorsoduro is one of the quieter areas of Venice yet you are within easy walking distance of the main art galleries and just one Vaporetto stop away from St Marks Square. Alternatively you can hop on one of the Traghetti (Public Gondolas) which ferry you across the Grand Canal for just 50 cents, both the Vaporetto and Traghetti stops are literally a minute's walk from the hotel. It is very difficult to find anything negative to say about the Ca' Maria. It is certainly on the expensive side, but you would probably expect that of Venice anyway. We did enquire about the hotel organising a Gondola ride and were told it would be 180 Euros for 50 minutes with a bottle of wine included. Doing this independently without the wine cost 100 Euros for 40 minutes, so it is probably worthwhile organising this yourself. As always, the biggest compliment you can pay anywhere is to say that when we return to Venice, we won't be looking anywhere else for accommodation. If you can't book a themed room then ask for room 332 - I think we'll give the Doge's room a try next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Retreat for our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: TauntonTravis
Reviews.Content: What a find! Ca Maria Adele was situated perfectly - a quiet location with no noise at all at night but only one vaporetta stop from St Mark's Square and only a fifteen minute walk if you preferred to. The staff were very helpful and even organised a physio for me because I had hurt my back. Nothing was too much trouble. From the minute we arrived we knew it was special when we were shown into the lounge with its sumptuous fittings and givena prosecco and cakes. We had a deluxe room at the front with marvellous view of the church and a wonderfully big bed which was delightfully comfortable especially for my husband who is 6ft 4ins and finds most beds too small. The room was very clean and very modern and the bathroom although small was very well appointed and the shower was big enough for two with lots of jets ideal for my bad back! Every evening the beds were turned down and rose petals and scents left on the pillows - breakfast in the quirky chinese style breakfast room or on the indian style terrace was a treat - cakes, bread and jam and even a cooked breakfast which is unusual in a city hotel. The staff recommended restaurants to us which were traditional and not expense and booked whatever we needed in advance - altoghether a wonderful experience and one that we will never forget - a wonderful wonderful start to our honeymoon and life together. We will definitely recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “The best in all of Venice!”
Reviews.Author: JMATTW
Reviews.Content: I have been to Italy for nearly 10 years and this was by far the best hotel I've stayed in. From the personal touch services (private water taxi at the train station) to the well-appointed themed suites (we stayed in the Moorish Suite), everything was amazing. Great location to everything and just a 5-star place. Much nicer than any other hotel I've ever stayed at in Venice. If you don't mind forking over a few extra euro, stay here - you'll never regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Just wow!”
Reviews.Author: monster_munch
Reviews.Content: Arriving in torrential rain is not the best way to start your trip to Venice, but I have to say this hotel is the best I have ever stayed in! We were lucky enough to ask for and get two ngihts in the Moor's room and two nights in the Doge's room. Both were amazing-the decor is so opulent but also so relaxing! The little touches like the range of toiletries, the complemtary mini bar, the prosecco and biscuits on arrival, the rose petals on the pillow at night-it is just amazing! We stayed during Carnevale, whihc anyone who has been at this time will know is a but mad in most parts of Venise-this hotel is like an oasis of calm-the beautiful music playing, the unbelievably helpful staff and the fact the only tourists you will find around here will probaly be ones who are lost! Not to say that this hotel is far away from the main sights-we were a 10 minute walk to th Accademia Bridge and also found a handy traghetto over to St marks about 2 mins from the hotel-this saves you about 20 mins walking and costs 1 euro for 2! There is no restaurant, but breakfast, which is included, is fantastic-prosecco, fresh juice, yoghurt, palma ham, eggs, ceral etc, etc! Beautiful-the dining room is gorgeous, although you can have breakfast anywhere. I really can't say enough good things about this hotel-it is so beautiful and yet so intimate and relaxing-there are only 12 bedrooms and we only saw 2 other people once in 5 days!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Perchadvisor
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to be staying at this small hotel for a few days, and we just loved it. Lovely rooms, superb location and friendly staff. Excellent breakfasts- inside or outside. Take the water taxi from Marco Polo for maximum effect. Great restaurant on Torcello - ask the hotel

Reviews.Title: “as good as the hype”
Reviews.Author: PaperDress
Reviews.Content: OK, so there are millions of reviews of this hotel telling you how amazing it is, and it really is that special; all discreet opulence and quiet, luxurious beauty. Literally one of the best hotels I and my other half have ever stayed in. So, just a few new, useful things to know alongside the other glowing reviewsâ€¦ 1 if you are staying in one of the un-themed, â€˜deluxâ€™ doubles, as we did, you might want to ask if it has a bath or shower before you go; not all have both and while our enormous shower was lovely, and perfect if you are in Venice in the sticky, tourist-ridden heat, I would have preferred a few hot baths after cold January days out on the vaperetto. 2. Many reviews mention the beds as uncomfortably hard. All I can say is that the bed in our room was unbelievably comfortable, to the point where we have resolved to buy a new bed â€“ literally â€“ on our return from Ca Maria Adele. 3. Not only is the hotel great but itâ€™s located in the coolest, prettiest part of Venice, Dorsodoro. We really liked â€˜Bar Artisteâ€™ on the way to Campo Margarita and the lovely hand-made paper shop next to the Guggenheim museum. 4. Venice is notorious for being a city that shuts down early but if you are like us, in our 30â€™s and wanting to enjoy the city after dark, there are loads of young Americans working at the Guggenheim who have their fingers on the pulse of the good places to drink, eat and dance in the city, more so than any guide book, we found, and they are generous with their recommendations, so do ask them. Enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful just wonderful”
Reviews.Author: PauliegirlLondon
Reviews.Content: What can I say that has not been said about Ca' Maria Adele? It's a wonderful place to stay if you want peace and quiet, well apart from the church bells that is. We had booked a room with a balcony view via the hotel's website, on arrivail we were told our that room was not ready. We were getting the overnight train to Paris in a few days so the concierge gave us a little map of the area and told us how to get to the train station so we could book our seats and by the time we got back our room would be ready, this would take about 45mins.
