With our train tickets booked and back at the hotel, we were told our room was ready and that we had been up graded to one of their themed rooms (result) I think it must have been the Moors room because it had two statues of moors boys holding a lamp each. At first I was a little put off but they became my bros by the end of my stay (me being black, but that's not important just a little fun). Everything about this hotel is clean, friendly and the staff can not do enough for you, your room is visited twice a day, once in the morning and once in the late afternoon to turn you bed down and leave you with rose petals and a face spray and apples on your bed. Breakfast is a choice from a long list and you can have as much or as little as you like, just one thing, the Italians only have a very little amount of very strong coffee in a cup. Did not get to the roof terrace but maybe next time, If you want a romantic place to stay at a nice relaxing hotel stay at Ca' Maria Adele.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel !! One of the best we have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: shell1_7
Reviews.Content: Having never visited Venice before, we looked on trip advisor for advice on a hotel, and Ca Maria Adele lived up to it's previous reviews. Everything you want from a hotel, cleanliness, very helpful staff, superb location, comfortable room, everything was perfect. Very close to St Mark's square and the shops. There is public boat transport very conveniently outside the hotel, which takes you 2 minutes across the water to all the main sights. I cannot name one bad thing about this hotel, its fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “We felt special”
Reviews.Author: keepthefaith
Reviews.Content: November 1st just arrived back fro a 3 day visit to wonderful Venice.Our stay and enjoyment was enhnced by this wonderful hotel.Although we did not need much assistance knowing that their expertise and advise were available provided us with a more confident approach. The hotel location is ideal being away from the maddening crowd which allows you to draw breath and relax before venturing out again.The rooms and decor are perfect and again help you to relax and soak in the atmosphere . This hotel will be a must for us when we return and we can assure you we will. Well done Ca Naria

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: daddyjock
Reviews.Content: Just stop searching for the perfect hotel in Venice because this is the one. Right next to the Salute is an idyllic spot with just twelve rooms. The staff are without exception helpful and no request is too small. The breakfast is a delight and can be served wherever suits your mood and the hotel has wonderful touches throughout.. Each room is individualised and ours overlooked the canal. A minute from the vaparetto stop and close to a number of super Art Galleries . Lovely little restaurant was recommended and did not disappoint. Take the Water Taxi transfer - the only way to travel.Just ignore the tariff it is worth every penny. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect experience”
Reviews.Author: ROADBIKE
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. I believe they only have 12 rooms and they treat you like you are at their home. Lovely room with a tub at the base of the bed. Good size bathroom for italy, cooked to order breakfast, mini-bar, plenty of good advice. When i needed the internet for work they handed me a laptop. 50 yards from the water bus. Because of the location, [ dorosdoro] very quiet with no crowds . Water taxi pulled right up to front door.A little expensive but well worth it. My hotel bill for 3 nights was three lines. everything was included so they do not nickel and dime you for mini bar, internet, etc. We received a drink when we arrived with a few snacks. They have a great terrace where you can have your breakfast in the morning and drinks in the afternoon. This hotel just capped off our wonderful time in Venice and i would recommend to anyone...

Reviews.Title: “Salute to the Ca' Maria Adele”
Reviews.Author: DandD50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the privelege of staying at the Ca Maria Adele last week. From the moment we arrived in the lobby with scented candles and lovely music we were transported to a peaceful and relaxed world. The hotel is one vaporetto stop from the hustle of San Marco, and right next to the beautiful Salute church in the more quiet area of Dosoduro. It is located an easy walking distance to museums and great restaraunts and around the corner from the Zattere where we enjoyed a run along the Grand Canal. Each night we enjoyed returning from dinner to the lanterns outside the hotel doors and the rose pedals on our pillow. We excitedly marked our breakfast selections and hung the card on our door to dream about fresh squeezed juices and cooked parma ham, all to arrive in our room at our requested time on a silver platter. We loved everything about our stay here and will be sure to return.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: JimboGloucester
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for our 30th wedding anniversary. It was fabulous. Very small but incredibly good service. The Night Receptionist was a real Italian Charmer and kept insisting my wife was Vanessa REdgrave (which she loved) Hotel is next to Salute Church and we were there when the Regata Storica was on, so literally 30 secs from Hotel to grandstand view of the event. Full cooked breakfast was beatifully served either on the terrace or in the breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “New Matresses Please!”
Reviews.Author: greasyhotelownerma
Reviews.Content: New Matresses Please! Most of everything you have read in the previous reviews is true! So why then will this excellent staff and it's brother owners allow it's guests to sleep on beds as hard as fine Italian marble? The hotel is very charming and is in a great location. The decor is fabulous and the candle scents invigorating. But truthfully, for nearly $600. per night the bed should be comfortable! I'm not the first or second or third person to make this comment..so why does this attentive staff and it's owner brothers allow it to go on? Lots of smiles from the staff when you come and go from the hotel...but who wouldn't smile as they collect $600. per night? Apples, rose petals, glasses of wine..it's all true but you would expect something more than a recommendation on where to find the best risotto for the price they are charging. And I'm not only referring to the cost of the room but also the price of the transfer to & from the airport and also a gondola ride..all over priced in my opinion. Please know that on my side the glass is half full and I chose to stay here..but would never stay at this hotel again...my lower back and my wallet can't take it nor would I subject my conscious to the fact that it takes more than apples, rose petals and smiles to justify their pricing. Let me close by giving you 2 more reasons to look elsewhere...one morning from 7:15 to 9:00 a.m., work was being done (bricks were being removed from the front of the hotel) and it was very loud! At this time of the morning, it also seems much louder as you are trying to sleep. Why didn't this attentive wonderful staff give notice to it's guests that the work was going to be done on this morning? Wouldn't that have been the polite thing to do? Every morning I made a request for apple cake or apple struedel to be delivered with the moring breakfast and every moring the request was not only ignored but also unfullfilled.?? Sometimes it's the little things that count and when you pay this amount of $$$$...nothing is too small. I left my photo at the hotel when I checked out...it's the last time they'll ever see me again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, wow, wow...this place is fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: ryzee
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice and booked this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews. The hotel was absolutely amazing. We stayed in two themed rooms the "Oriental" and the "Sala Noir" and both were beautiful but the "Sala Noir" was over the top fantastic. The "Sala Noir" was two stories with the bathroom upstairs and what a wow the bathroom was, the shower had four different shower head configurations and was sized for two people. The bedroom in "Sala Noir" was amazing as well with a huge 2 meter diameter Murano glass chandelier hanging over the bed. I'm gushing, I know, but there is more.... The service was absolutely top notch. From the moment your water taxi arrives at there private dock you are treated as royalty. As your bags are being delivered to your room you are asked to rest in the most amazing lounge/living room area, as you decompress from your trip to Venice inhaling the scented candles and absorbing the amazing design and decorations in the opulent room you are presented with glasses of complimentary prosecco sparkling wine to sip as you wait for them to make your room perfect. Being such a small boutique hotel every request was met instantly, you literally put the phone down and there is a knock on the door with your request. Everyday we had a small surprise from fresh apples in the room when we returned from site seeing to a new orchid to complimentary glasses of wine to welcome us to our 2nd new themed room......are you getting the picture. Breakfast was amazing. They will serve it in your room, the breakfast room, on the terrace or in the lounge. The breakfast was served with the finesse of a fine dining restaurant by the sweetest, most charming waitress. The staff were over the top helpful with everything you requested. I can't imagine a better hotel in Venice and will be recommending it to everyone heading there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Romantic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZMJL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in July. Wonderful location just off the grand canal but also very quiet and romantic. We had 2 themed rooms, each very individual with eveything you would expect from a top hotel. Service was excellent and breakfast first class. They don't do evening meals but will make reservations for you, nothing was too much trouble. Only thing we didnt like so much was that the beds are a bit hard. However, we would definately return

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting & Exceptional !”
Reviews.Author: JRRDI
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend and I had the pleasure of staying in this truly magnificient hotel in July 2007. Quite simply, I cannot rate the Ca Maria Adele high enough. It is a small but breathtakingly romantic hotel who prize asset is its staff. Every single member of staff were exceptional and their attention to detail to ensure we had a wonderful time was perfect. The location is ideal, the rooms are stunning, we stayed in the La Sala Noir themed room - WOW ! The staff will arrange anything for you, from restaurant reservations to a private Gondola trip (expensive at 180 euros but well worth it to add to your 'Venice Experience') In synopsis, if you are looking for a wonderful, discreet, charming and romantic hotel in Venice, then the Ca Maria Adele is 'The One'

Reviews.Title: “The perfect honeymoon hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrHypno
Reviews.Content: What a place! A very small hotel with service when and where you want it. The five or six staff soon get to know you and know how you wnat your stay to be. They are smart and professional, yet helpful and friendly. We stayed in the Moorish Room, which has a balcony overlooking the Basilica. Every night something new greeted us in the room; petals, chocolates, prosecco...wonderful. Breakfast can be taken in your room, in a lovely breakfast room or up on the terrace. The styling is decadent colours and fabrivs in a modern way, with a very Moorish touch. Quite quirky really. Breakfast is very good indeed as are the coffees. The reception will organise trips to the opera, gondola rides and anything you want really. Our thanks go out to all at the hotel making our honeymoon, and my birthday, so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Molto bello! And more besides.......”
Reviews.Author: webmanmike
Reviews.Content: A simply perfect stay! As so many couples do, we chose Venice for our honeymoon in June of 2007. And it wasn't just the perfect weather (pure sunshine and 30 degrees) that made our stay there so wonderful. This truly is a World Class hotel - part of the Mr and Mrs Smith collection - and having travelled a great deal of it we have some excellent benchmarks. The imagination and attention to detail as a result of the restoration is obvious as soon as you enter the hotel, assisted greatly by the glass of chilled sparkling wine that we were handed! The decor is thoughtful and in keeping with the building yet still modern and functional. Breakfast is to die for - room, lounge or terrace - and both the choice and quality warrant a full 5 stars. Staff are knowledgeable and helpful with nothing being too much trouble. The location is perfect being 1 Vaporetto stop across from St Marks square - buy your tourist pass and hop on and off as you please - and yet you can be away from the crowds within minutes to this quiet part of Dorsoduro. Not the cheapest of hotels but it will make your stay in Venice all the more memorable. You will not be dissappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny, believe me!!!”
Reviews.Author: cruiser41
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night as we were leaving for a cruise the next day, but our stay was truly magical. The hotel and hotel staff are AMAZING. After a long flight and a "James Bond-like" water-taxi ride to their private dock from the airport, we were greeted by three gentlemen in impressive Italian suits. After being given a complimentary welcoming drink and Italian cookies to relax to, we were upgraded at no cost to one of their theme rooms (the Oriental Room). The accommodations were truly first class... You can pick what you like for breakfast and it will be delivered to your location of choice (the terrace, your room, or in the breakfast room at no charge). After fueling up on breakfast, Venice is yours to discover. We enjoyed being across the canal from the madness of St. Mark's Square. There are many, many shops and restaurants within 5-10 walking minutes of the hotel and if you want to go over to St. Mark's, you can get there in about 20 mins walk or by taking a water taxi, public water bus, or gondola. Very minor concerns for some might be the very small TV's in the rooms (but who goes to Venice to watch TV, right?), and the beds are a bit hard. And if you want to be able to walk to St. Mark's in one minute or less from your hotel, stay on the other side of the canal. In short, I highly recommend this hotel. Certainly it is, IMO, better than many of the so called "five star" properties in the states, especially when it comes to service. Being a small hotel, they truly give you the red carpet treatment. We can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “They even have a designer dog”
Reviews.Author: luckybeggar
Reviews.Content: As almost everyone else has said, this place is magical. Expensive, but magical and worth it for a special occasion (we went for our honeymoon). We'll remember it forever and it's by far the most interesting and lovely hotel in Venice (much better than the jaded Excelsior, that's for sure). Best of all is their lovely rescued dog, Fausto!

Reviews.Title: “"Truly Amazing"”
Reviews.Author: TheLuckyTraveller
Reviews.Content: Such a shame that this hotel got a poor review on June 19th. It deserves every star from "tripadviser". We arrived on July 6th for a 2 night stay in the Doge room for our 10th wedding anniversary. We where recieved with a nice glass of prosecco in the lounge and, after the staff made clear our room was in perfect condition, shown to our room. Apart from breakfast in our fantastic Doge room we can recommend breakfast on the charming roof terrace. The hotel is filled with nice smells and music and is absolutely relaxing after a full day walking in Venice. We normally do not spend much time in a hotelroom during a city visit but had to make a exception this time as it was an experience on itself. Depending on if you like to walk or take the waterbus (Vaporetto) it will take you 20 or 2 minutes to the other side from the grand canale. We preferred to walk as the direct environment of the hotel is supurb and has some nice shops and galeries. The staff was very helpfull and available day and night. This hotel is excactely what we expected from a Beautique hotel. We had very high expectations, which is not always a good thing, but the hotel was even better as we expected. Thank you for a lovely weekend. L&L

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB FIND....”
Reviews.Author: YandP
Reviews.Content: A superb hotel in a wonderful location. The service was 100% throughout our entire stay. We arrived by river taxi to be greeted by the front of house with a chilled glass of prosecco and pastries. We were then shown to The Dogge Room which can only be described as spectacular, very regal and a delight to stay in. We stayed for 3 nights and frequently asked advice on where to visit, how to make the most of our stay and we were not disappointed. The front of house made us feel as though we were the only people staying there because of the attention to our needs that he gave us. (We clearly weren't the only people staying there as we did meet people at breakfast!) A very romantic suggestion from the front of house to my partner was to book a private gondola to pick us up outside of the hotel with an ice bucket and bottle of prosecco waiting for us. The trip took 55 minutes and we were taken anti clockwise away from the normal tourist route, made to feel extremely special and were waved off by the front of house. The moroccan style terrace area on the first floor is very quiet, peaceful and a surprise to find - a real sun trap. The breakfast selection is vast and our waitress was delightful. The cleanliness is 100% and the hotel is immaculate. The owners came to see us off on our last day and to shake our hands. A very caring, special hotel and one that I would highly recommend and definitely go back to. Yvette and Paul

Reviews.Title: “superb boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: rapjkp
Reviews.Content: I booked a 4 night stay directly through the internet witih no problem. Requested a room with a view of the grand canal and that is exactly what we got. The staff was very attentive and helpful, reconfirming reservations at resturants and making a couple for us also. the location is across from all the bustle in San Marco. It was lovely to walk around the area on all the smaller canals and sidestreets. The room was large and very nice witih a bathroom that also had a window that overlooked the canal. The AC worked great which was very welcome at the end of June when it was starting to get warm. Twice daily service to the room assures you of plenty of towels. Lots of little extras in the room and bathroom, including a free minibar stocked with coca colas and water and juices. Breakfast was very nice and served ina choice of 4 different areas including your room. You could order Prosecco if you chose to, along with coffee and jucies, rolls ,eggs and many other choices. The only thing we could find to complain of was that the bed although kingsized and full of comfy pillows was very hard. It is true that there is no lift as this is a very old building and must be remodeled according to strict quidelines that does not premit an elevator. A problem for several museums also. the climb up to the 3rd floor at the end of the day was not always what we wanted to do, but the view and comfort of the room made it acceptable.. The bottle of prosecco sent up for our 25th anniversary was a nice touch. One last word about the price. Yes it was expensive but in my research for a place to stay in Venice , I didn't find any hotel that was not expensive and none that came with as many good reviews as the Ca' Maria Adele. On our 17 day vacation of Italy we stayed at 5 different hotels and the Adele was at the top of our list.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ZiaLondon
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to find out about this hotel through an offer in a magazine, which meant we stayed 3 nights for the price of 1! It was a truly wonderful experience; the welcome drink, sumptuous breakfasts, and the ever helpful staff made it a trip to remember. The roof terrace was a real highlight, as we had it to ourselves, and had bottles of wine and nibbles delivered to us by the ever attentive staff. The rooms were stunning, and so cooling after a day walking around Venice in the middle of August. I would higly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: electraglide33
Reviews.Content: Simply put this charming hotel is in a nice location across the Gand Canal from St. Marks square. It's convenient & yet quieter. However, the hotel is overpriced, the staff less than helpful, even arrogant & beware of steps. We stayed in the suite on the 3rd floor - nearly 50 steps to get to our room - no elevator (or lift as they say) Doesn't sound too bad until you visit the room in the evening to freshen up for dinner after walking all day. Then return at the end of the evening & it was like climbing mount everest! However, all this is somewhat incidental. While checking out, we wanted to review our bill for our stay. The staff insisted that the bill was correct & there was no need to check the charges. We told them we appreciated their assurance but wanted to check anyway. They seemed insulted & became rude. Truly not first class service. On another occasion we asked about restaurants & they were less than helpful - only telling us that a restaurant that had come recommended to us was booked & there was no point in trying to get a reservation

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: lilifisher
Reviews.Content: Wonerful location, very helpful staff, comfortable and clean rooms. Atmostphere everywhere, inside and outside as well. Quiet location away from the crowds but only one vaporetto stop from St. Marks. Well worth the money. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: emmieBournemouth
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two night visit to this hotel. It was wonderful- situated adjoining a canal on the Dorsoduro right next to Santa Maria della Salute Church just across from St Marks Square. The bedroom was large with lovely soft pillows and duvet. The bathroom was super with great toiletries and a huge shower. The breakfast room was beautifully tasteful as was the lounge and moroccan style roof terrace where we sipped prosecco - divine! The breakfasts were excellent! We could not fault this hotel in any way and will certainly return again.

Reviews.Title: “Just sublime”
Reviews.Author: SteveWLondon
Reviews.Content: Don't bother reading any further. This hotel is perfect, probably the best I have stayed in. If the price is not a problem, then you won't be disappointed. Make sure you get a motorboat in from the airport, thats good fun. A glass of champagne on arrival set the tone.The rooms are sumptuous and the staff are great, suggesting helpful things, tips for getting around and helping out with any little requests. The breakfast on the terrace is wonderful and filling out the list of all the items that you want for breakfast the next morning was a cool little chore in the evenings. The location is perfect too, its near the main San Marco district, but just over the Grand Canal in a slightly more quiet corner of Venice. You can get right into the heart of Venice very quickly, but you can also wonder around the locality of your hotel in the evenings and actually get away from the maddening crowds. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: xeqmatt
Reviews.Content: I booked the room myself, from the start to the end of the booking process the staff was very attentive to my inquiries. The Hotel is very well taken care of, and we loved our room (We stayed in one of the theme rooms). The location is very quiet, and altough it may seem far from the main attractions the 'Vaporetto' stop is a minute walk (literally !) from the hotel, and just one stop away from the 'Piazza San Marco'. The service was flawless, and the breakfast very good. The only thing i disliked was the matress, a bit hard by normal standards.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless Idyllic luxury”
Reviews.Author: Happydayz69
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from our first trip to Venice where we had the pleasure of a 2 night stay at the Ca Maria Adele in the Fireside room. We heard about this secret hideaway in the Mr and Mrs Smith European Hotel guide and decided to treat ourselves to one of the hotel's 5 themed rooms. Previous posts have complained about this particular room and I have to disgaree with all these comments. First, the room is located just around the corner from the reception desk off the lobby and although previous posts complained about noise we didn't find this to be an issue. Second, a previous post complained that the room had no windows, after a little bit of investigation, we managed to find these hidden behind large silk curtains and they opened directly onto the canal with a perfect view of the church of the Santa Maria della Salute opposite. Third, the room has a flat screen TV and DVD player and although not a 42" plasma it did the job, after all we came to see Venice not Jerry Springer! (Ps: If your essential holiday requirements include yellow taxis, Ice machines and McDonalds then Venice is not for you!) The ensuite was fantastic with a huge walk in shower, but swamp lovers be advised that there is no bath in this suite. The staff were all fantastic and couldn't do enough for us. The Lineadombra restaurant just around the corner from the hotel is excellent and the view from the pontoon terrace across the water is breathaking. The Ca Maria Adele has an excellent roof terrace which is perfect for some afternoon drinking and the quiet non-tourist ambience of the Dorsoduro area of venice is by far the jewel in the crown of the Ca Maria Adele's location. The Salute water bus stop is barely a 2 min walk from the hotel and 2 Euro's each gets you across the grand canal. After 5 mins being pushed and pulled by the tourist masses you will soon realise that the best of Venice is within 10 mins walk of the hotel so it 's really not a problem being on the opposite side of the Grand Canal to the main 'attractions'. If you are staying for 2 days, then it is worth having an afternnon snack on the roof terrace of the Danieli Hotel next to Doges' Palace in San Marco. It opens at 3pm and don't be put off by the grand entrance hall downstairs, just walk straight in and take the elevator to the top floor. The view is excellent as are the lunchtime salads. Finally, a James Bond water taxi direct from the airport to the Ca Maria Adele Lobby is a must. We paid 90 Euro each way and the journey takes about 35 mins. We thoroughly recommend the Ca Maria Adele to anyone wishing to get the best that Venice has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Magic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Aion
Reviews.Content: I felt as in a fantastic casket - in this small and luxury hotel. All stylishly also designed with carefulness. Very kind and useful staff. The porter has recommended me the same magnificent and small fish restaurant (Lineadombra) a stone's throw from hotel. Though also dear, but it that costs. Such gentle seafoods carpaccio seldom it is possible to try. The owner - the enthusiast of the business. Too it is possible to tell and about hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but very hard beds.”
Reviews.Author: MQS007
Reviews.Content: We were staying at the Gritti and feeling ripped off. As we walked one day we happened apon the Ca Maria Adele and were drawn to the building, though we did not know what it was as we did not see a sign. The hotel is modern and could have been a design firm's offices. The staff were most accomodating, showed us several rooms and offered to discount the price. We moved. The service and rooms are top rate. The value was good (with the negotiated discount that included free mini bar and breakfast). They were prepared to do this as we were walkins and the hotel was not full in March. The staff were able to get us a reservation at a restuarant that the Gritti told us was impossible. I only have two resevations. The first is, like others on here, I too found the beds just way to hard. It is surprising for a new hotel that clearly spent so much money on building the hotel that they would miss so badly on the beds (unless of course you like hard beds). I spend 30 -60 nights a year in hotels on business so I know what I am talking about on the beds. The second issue is that it is on the other side of the Grand Canal from St Marcs. The regular Vapareto stops at about 11 and the night boat does not stop at the hotels stop and is a long wait. This resulted one night after a great but late dinner in us having to take a water taxi, and did we get taken 40 Euro to simply cross the Canal. Having said all this I would stay again for a short visit. For a longer visit I love the Laundra Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Did not quite meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: IslandGrl
Reviews.Content: I have waited to write a review for this hotel because I so wanted to give it my highest rating,and thought my impression might improve with time, but while lovely, the Ca' Maria Adele fell just short of our expectations. We found the location, rooms, ambience and breakfast to be just delightful. We found the breakfast "girl" to be most accomodating and interesting. Restaurant recommendations from the front desk too, were outstanding. We booked a concept room for 3 nights. During our stay we found the service to be fine, but unremarkable. Upon check-in, we were given the main floor room, "the Fireside Room". The room is lobby level and canal level - just steps from the front desk. We did not understand until the following morning why the room had double entry doors. Because of it's location, that particular room is VERY, VERY noisy in the morning. We were awakened early by staff going in/out of an office or storage closet, talking to guests. It seems like the double door system is to block out the noise. "The Fireplace room" while beautiful, is dark and has NO WINDOWS that open or let light in (except in the bathroom) which for me was very claustrophobic. We visited in November, and found that room to be very warm. I cannot imagine what it would be like during the summer months. When we expressed our concern, the staff indicated that they had "never had a compliant" before, but promptly switched us to the "Oriental Room", which was indeed very lovely, spacious and met our expectations. Windows opened on two sides. I truly felt like a guest in someone's home. I don't know why were were initially booked into the Fireside Room - as there is no comparison between the two suites. One night we also selected a video from the collection available to guests and were given some brief instructions from the front desk staff on how to operate the DVD equipment. Needless to say after many attempts we were not able to get the equipment to operate and contacted the front desk who begrudingly agreed to come look at it. A gentleman arrived, and after 15 minutes of trying, also could not get the equipment to work, shrugged, said sorry "it doesn't work" and left. My husband, not to be defeated by technology, continued to work on the equipment, and eventually got it to work. The TVs though flat screen are small - maybe 15" size. We wandered around the hotel a bit, and found a quiet, upper patio that was a wonderful respite. Again, the front desk or staff could have just taken a few moments to describe the hotel ammenities. During our stay we found the front desk alouf and perhaps a bit too impressed with themselves or the success of their hotel. Do make sure you have clear directions on how to get to the hotel to provide to vaporetto drivers. Ca' Maria Adele is a unique, beautiful, small hotel. Room rates are very, very high, and, at those rates, service should be personal and exceptional. Should I return, I am not sure the concept rooms are worth the spurlge.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: love2travel79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I LOVED the hotel. We were upgrated to a suite upon arrival! We were greeted with champagne and snacks. We did not have to go through a typical check-in. We found this hotel to be very romantic and close to everything. 1 vaporetto stop away from San Marco. The staff was extremely attentive. The hotel is located in the quieter but charming area of Dorsoduro next to the Santa Maria della Salute. Stay here! You will not regret it!!

Reviews.Title: “Home From Home”
Reviews.Author: KarencEssex
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Venice many times for business and pleasure, but I have to say out of all the hotels I have stayed in, this is the best. It really does feel very homely. The staff are so helpful and the little extras (that most hotels try to charge for, to get more money out of you) are given to you with their complements. The decor of this hotel is amazing. We even received a thank you card a week later, from the hotel. All those special touches make such a BIG difference. My husband and I will definitely be going back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: christopherp
Reviews.Content: The Ca Maria Adele is not a cheap hotel so expectations are high before arriving. As soon as we set foot in the place we were made to feel so welcome. A glass of sparkling wine was served, luggage taken to the room and friendly conversation from the staff. The bedroom was fantastic and so comfortable. The location is great too as you are away from the noisy areas but a stones throw from the water bus on the main canel. We only stayed for 2 nights and can't wait to return

Reviews.Title: “Superb Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Vguiness
Reviews.Content: Loved this small hotel, with a great location on the Grand Canal and right next door to the Salute Church. The staff were polite and very helpful, no problems with the English language. Will never forget the Saturday night when the Salute bells were ringing followed by all the church bells around Venice. Close to San Marco Square. If you stay on the top floor be ready for a walk up the stairs to your room.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Fairy_Legs
Reviews.Content: My partner and I chose this hotel for our honeymoon and as soon as we walked into the lobby we knew we had made the right choice. The hotel and staff were absolutely exceptional throughout the whole stay. We had booked a double deluxe room but as we were on our honeymoon we were upgraded to a suite at no extra cost. The hotel and surrounding area are spotless and the breakfast was outstanding (we jokingly took a picture of it as we were gobsmacked at the quantity!), you can also request to have your breakfast delivered to your room at no extra cost. When booked direct with the hotel there is a private excursion to the murano glass island. The hotel arranges for a water taxi to take you there and rings ahead to let the people at Murano island know you are coming, this is another example of the amazing service. I could talk about our experience forever but all I have left to say is that this is a beautiful hotel in a very convenient and classy part of Venice and we will deffinitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Planning our next trip already!”
Reviews.Author: joycatherinemarshall
Reviews.Content: Fantastic! Fab rooms. Great breakfast. Superb location. Staff even managed to retrieve my specs when I left them on a Gondola...

Reviews.Title: “5 out of 5 but beware the bed”
Reviews.Author: fussytripper
Reviews.Content: fabulous hotel we stayed for three nights in sept. wonderful position, staff and rooms, totally agree with the other reviews so i won't repeat they views too much. We stayed in the moorish suite which was wonderful, had a balcony over the canal, but i'm afraid we had trouble with the bed too --very hard my husband could'nt stand it, however, the hotel found him a duvet to put on top of the mattress, this helped a little This would be our only grumble and i do think that the management will eventually have to do something to rectify this as we are obviously not the only people to find it a problem. for the price we paided i would expect to have a good nights sleep, if this was put right then this hotel would be 100% heaven My thanks to all the staff for a wonderful stay

Reviews.Title: “Grazie Alle!”
Reviews.Author: mdwest
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Ca' Maria Adele for a week in September. We were thrilled by the location of this wonderful boutique hotel. Located across the Grand Canal from St. Mark's Square in the charming sestieri Dorsoduro, Ca' Maria Adele is a wonderful way to visit Venice and to experience life in the Venetian way. I won't repeat the other reviews, as they have done a nice job of describing the hotel, staff and services. A few notes for travelers: The hotel does not have a lift, and the stairs are steep. Our room was on the top (third) floor; if you have difficulty climbing stairs be sure to ask for a room on a lower floor. The terrace is located on the second floor, and is something of a hidden treasure. We "found" it one day looking out our window, then explored the building until we figured out how to get there. Eduardo brought us glasses of prosecco and some nuts as a snack; it was very nice. The vaporetto is very convenient (Salute stop) with Linea Uno (1) going both ways on the Canal. Boats come every 10 minutes or so every day from dawn until 11pm or so. There is a night line with different hours also but we didn't use it. There are many nice restaurants within a short 10 minute walk in the Dorsoduro and along the Zattere. The hotel staff will make reservations, which are very important when the weather prevents you from sitting outside. Many restaurants are very small -- only a few tables inside -- so reservations are needed! A public laptop computer is provided off the lobby for internet; access from the rooms is dial-up only (no high-speed internet in the rooms). The breakfast is fantastic! Continental breakfast, coffee or tea, juice, plus cooked-to-order eggs and bacon or ham, served in the pleasant breakfast room overlooking the canal and the S. Maria della Salute church. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. We were very pleased with the help from Francisco and Gabrielle at the desk, and Eduardo who made sure we had everything we needed. We recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to experience Venice -- without the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Helen_&_Rob
Reviews.Content: The location, charm of the staff and service could not have been better. A very romantic retreat ! We stayed in 336 - the suite with the jacuzzi at the end of the bed in the web site pictures. A spacious, quirky room with good views and very quiet. The bed is the biggest [and highest] we've ever slept in and although firm we had a good nights sleep every night. The front desk will arrange tours, transfers etc and although not the cheapest, for first time Venice visitors they take all the hassle out of it for you. The hotel is just 1 vaporetti stop from San Marco and 3 stops or 10 min stroll from Academia in a quiet, gentile area with nice shops - far, far nicer to us than the frantic St Marks square area. They booked restaurants every night for us. Tip - e mail about a week in advance with what you would like them to book and there was no trouble getting in anywhere - even Harrys Bar and Cips Club.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than expected”
Reviews.Author: tamba
Reviews.Content: For the first time in my life I found a hotel that was even better than it looked from the web. Everything was perfect: the rooms, the service, the location, right across from San Marco but on quiet Dorsoduro. Definetly worth a little splurge!

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: JTFV
Reviews.Content: Venice was my gateway city on a two week holiday in Italy. It couldn't have started out better. We splurged and took a water Taxi from the airport (about E85) right up to the front door of this hotel. The cozy lobby felt like I was entering into someone's well decorated house. I don't think there are but about 12 rooms here. I had the "Fireside Room" right off of the lobby. I was concerned about noise, but never heard a thing once the door was shut. Great bathroom, all super clean, fresh and modern. Keep in mind this hotel is across the canal from Piazza San Marco. This means waiting for a water bus (about 5 minutes) to get into the thick of it. Perfect if you have a few days here since you'll quickly grow weary of the day trippers. However if you are blowing through Venice in a one day frenzy, or are one of those people that goes back to the hotel several times a day, you may want to stay on the other side. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “much better than you would expect”
Reviews.Author: Fuoriporta
Reviews.Content: Hallo. I've been there for just a couple of days, but I've had an outstanding impression of every detail in these better-than-your-home hotel. The service is much better than in other great famous hotels not only in Venice but in all europe. The rooms are really original and you would stay there many more days than you'd do. It's not an hotel, it's much more: feels like a private paradise with a personal majordome at service... really close to S. Marco but on the better side of Canal Grande, where you'll not find all the tourists' invasion... the best spent money of last 5 years. Don't miss a tour in Gondola starting from the Hotel ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect...Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: PaulN
Reviews.Content: I had never been to Venice before and wanted somewhere great to stay; and I certainly found it. I have stayed at some world renowned hotel but the service at the Ca Maria Adele was far better. There was nothing too much trouble and everyone was professional and friendly. I stayed in a deluxe room. The room was a good size with a small seating area and, what appeared to be, a brand new bathroom. The room was spotlessly clean and very tasteful. I had been told that I had been allocated a room with a view of the canal before I arrived but was given a one overlooking the garden but it didn't matter at all. Breakfast was lovely and more than ample. The service was fast and friendly. The location is marvellous. It is quiet and yet very close to the main attractions. It is situated in a lovely area of the city. I would recommend anyone to stay at this hotel. In fact, I only arrived back in the UK less than 24 hours agoi and I have already told a close friend that a stay is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pumpkintoo
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending a fantastic weekend at Ca Maria Adele. Everything was perfect and the attention to detail was faultless. From the moment we arrived we were treated so well and made to feel so very welcome - big brownie points for the glass of champagne and strawberries!. Our room was stunning with lovely fluffy bathrobes/slippers and yummy toiletries. Breakfast was also excellent with fresh fruit, pastries and a choice of eggs, bacon etc. The location is also a great thing as it was relaxing to get away from the crowds after a day of sightseeing. It is also conveniently situated next to a 'water-bus' station so you can easily pop over to St Mark's square. You will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Stylish Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zaziecat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ca Maria Adele for 2 nights on our honeymoon and it was the highlight hotel of our 3 week tour of Italy. We had a lovely deluxe room that was an opulent, yet sleek update on traditional Venetian damask interiors and had a great view of the church Santa Maria della Salute. Although it is a very chic hotel, we were pleased to find that the staff were very friendly, and greeted us on arrival with 2 glasses of champagne and passion fruit. They have lots of little personalized touches, with rose petals at turndown, nice bath products, and robes and slippers. The breakfast was good and plentiful and they serve it in a sunny room upstairs. We woke up every morning to the smell of pastries cooking, which made it easy to get out of bed, and also made you feel like you were staying in some aristocrat's home. We also really liked the location, which has some tourists during the day, but they all clear out at night and it is very quiet. We asked the concierge to recommend a nice restaurant for us, and they sent us to a an amazing restaurant that was out of the main tourist area, and served traditional Venetian seafood. We had tiny fried softshell crabs, a venetian specialty only available in June. Although the hotel is not cheap, we felt that it was a very good value for Venice and is an especially romantic retreat for couples. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Dorsoduro”
Reviews.Author: claudiac
Reviews.Content: My husband and I splurged ($500 US) for a suite a Ca Maria Adele, a 12 room "luxury B&B" in the Dorsoduro section of Venice. Our suite had a small balcony and was beautifully appointed. Breakfast offerings were fresh and plentiful. In the past I have stayed at the wonderful Pensione Accademia but they were fully booked. The upside is that the hotel is in a quiet, less traffiked area so after a day of running around Venice you can relax to peace and quiet, But before you go make sure that they are done with the construction going on in several rooms. They were discreet but there's no question that it was an annoying thing to wake up to. In the end, we loved the hotel but...when we go back my first choice will still be Pensione Accademia.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: Sgreeners
Reviews.Content: Just back from Ca Maria Adele, and I have to say it is a truly wonderful little hotel. It's in a fantastic, quiet location, and although it's easy to get over the water to the bustle of St Marks et al, we were very, very tempted not to bother. The hotel is quite swanky so we were slightly concerned to turn up there with a five-year-old in tow, but the staff could not have been kinder or more accommodating. The restaurant recommended to us for supper didn't look much, but the food and service were fantastic - perfect. The rose petals on the beds at night were a lovely touch, but that's what this place is about - attention to detail. Through work I've stayed in some supposedly top-notch hotels across the world, but none has has managed to combine style with a warm welcome like this place - believe the hype!

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: EvaSanClementeCA
Reviews.Content: We loved the Ca Maria Adele. The hotel staff and owner were so attentive. The room was incredible and so so charming. We were greeted by champagne and passion fruit within 5 minutes of walking into our hotel. The breakfast room and the meal itself were just great. All the recommendations given by the hotel staff were awesome. Would LOVE LOVE to go back...

Reviews.Title: “Magical - A perfect hideaway in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Scotsman1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned home from a superb 5 night stay at the Caâ€™ Maria Adele. Having read the excellent reviews on Tripadvisor and visited their excellent web-site (--------) this seemed to be exactly what we were looking for being quiet, intimate, luxurious and â€œcharacterfulâ€�. It certainly was all four. This is a small hotel having only 14 rooms in all. Having booked one of their five â€œthemed roomsâ€�, we were initially given the â€œFireplace Roomâ€� for the first night but were offered the â€œOriental Roomâ€� for the remainder of our stay. As this gave us the chance to experience more than one of what appeared to be a unique style of accommodation we accepted. (See photographs). On arrival we were treated to a welcoming glass of Champagne served with passion fruit which exemplified the first class attention you receive at this hotel. The rooms were excellent though I must agree with other reviews that the beds seem universally â€œfirmâ€� and I do mean â€œfirmâ€�! and took a little getting used to. Furnishings throughout the hotel are luxurious and the extensive use of scented candles burning, it appeared, throughout the day as well as evening added to the magical atmosphere. Breakfast is taken in a room overlooking the Church of Santa Marie della Salute and again continues the unique charm of this hotel. Apart from a small buffet of cereals and fresh fruit there is a choice of beverages; fruit juices and egg dishes together with hams and bacon. A selection of rolls and croissants is also offered. The small â€œliving-roomâ€� has a great atmosphere and is a haven of tranquillity. A great place to enjoy a pre- or post dinner drink or just a quiet coffee. The hotel itself lies at one end of the Sestiere Dorsoduro and is located on a small canal and opposite the Basillica of San Salute. This is a very quiet area yet is only 2 minutes by Vaporetto (water bus) from St Marks Square. The Vaparetto stop is only 50 meters or so from the hotel. Though pricey, I would personally recommend a transfer between the airport and hotel by taxi as, apart from the convenience of door to door and the enjoyment of the water trip itself, the prospect of negotiating the water buses with luggage did not appeal. Even in late March they are VERY crowded. The staff are very friendly and always anxious to please without being overwhelming. I have stayed in many hotels (luxurious and otherwise) in various parts of the world but there are only a very few which I would describe as magical. The Swan in Lavenham, England; The Portmerion Hotel in Wales and certainly the Caâ€™ Maria Adele in Venice. It is unique. If you are looking for a real experience rather than just â€œsomewhere to stayâ€� I would thoroughly recommend this hotel however in doing so I realise it may make it more difficult to book there again!

Reviews.Title: “If you want quiet in Venice”
Reviews.Author: TORRAN1
Reviews.Content: The water taxi takes guests straight to the door of this wonderful boutique hotel, situated next to Santa Maria de Salute at the entrance to the Grand Canale. The location, one minute across the water from St Marks Square, means that it is very peaceful and quiet and there is a feeling of luxury from the moment of arrival. The room we stayed in is small but had canal views and the staff put rose petals on our bed each night - very romantic. The owners made great suggestions for dinner and lunch and can organise special trips and occasions due to their knowledge of the area and their contacts. We visit Venice regularly and will use this hotel from now on.

Reviews.Title: “You'll Love It”
Reviews.Author: sharkey77
Reviews.Content: Just simply a great place. Everything you'd expect inside from a hotel in Mr & Mrs Smith, really nicely decorated. Fantastic location (1 stop from San Marco or about 15 mins walk if you want to go over the bridge). The staff are great, they will book absolutely anything for you, and can recommend some fantasic restaurants away from the main tourist drag. Basically your only concern might be that you are on the "wrong side" of the grand canal, but actually you're on absolutely the right side. Its so easy to nip across if you do want to be drowned in tourist-traps, but if not you're in one of the most beautiful parts of Venice. Go for it - you won't be disappointed (unless they are now fully booked!!).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: skyfive1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying at this small hotel on the Grand Canal.It is in a perfect situation just 20 steps from the water bus stop Nos 1 which takes you straight across the Grand Canal to St Marks Square and the tourist hoardes.We booked a standard room with Expedia which was a little expensive as it was Carnival time Â£420 FOR 2 NIGHTS.The expense was worth it.The greeting was very friendly.The manager brought us champagne with fruit in roses after we checked in.The room was gorgeous with fabric walls, thick towels and bath robes and the bed huge with loads of pillows and cushions.Breakfast was efficienty served and was a buffet and whatever else you would like.Cool place.We want to go back!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One Of a Kind”
Reviews.Author: Tof
Reviews.Content: IÂ´had spend the time of my life in this hotel. Everyhing is different. The offer, the service and even the breakfast. Instead of having the concept "one room fits all" , this guys have done a one of a kind hotel. Every single room have an history trough a specic and beautiful decoration which gives you the feeling that you are unique. The managment team (who also owns the hotel) is always there and they have a realy nice attitude - one can feel that are between friends since the very first day. If you just want a place to stay for few nights, donÂ´t choose Ca Maria Adele, because they have so much more to offer. They are not one more hotel, they are a unique experience.

Reviews.Title: “precisely what one imagines a small Venetian hotel to be at its best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Ca Maria Adele is ideal in every respect. It sits on a quiet little canal just behind the magnificent Chiesa di Santa Maria and not far from the Accademia. The staff was very friendly, treated its guests with real coridality and were brimming with suggestions and assistance. Breakfast was especially satisfying in a tall room that spangled with Venetian ornament. The hotel felt very personal, it was like staying at the home of a friend. Who should stay here? Couples, old or young, families, no matter the size, single folk, businessmen. I look forward to going back to Venice and when I do so staying at the Ca Maria Adele. Recommended without any reservation whatever.

Reviews.Title: “charming and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our weekend at the Ca Maria Adele Hotel. Arriving at the hotel from the airport by water taxi was a pleasure - the hotel is beautiful and in an amazing spot, right next to the Salute vaporetto stop. All the hotel staff were charming, the front desk staff spoke perfect English and French and were very warm and friendly. We were given the Black Suite at no extra cost, what a treat. On two floors, with a huge black Murano glass chandalier over the very large double bed, this room is magnificent. The whole hotel looks lovely, modern yet not minimalist, cosy not twee. Breakfast was delicious, served in a marble floored dining room by a sweet Italian girl. Excellent proscuitto, lovely croissants and rolls, delicious coffee. The service was fantastic throughout. All in all, i would not hesitate to recommend Ca Maria Adele. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great "Bijou" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good location; enough off the beaten track to be quiet and relaxing but a great short walk to Accademia and other sites. If you like exploring places on foot its ideal. If you don't, the Vaporetto is on the door step and we had no problem getting anywhere in the city and the islands using it. Hotel was our kind of place; good style mixture of contemporary blending with the traditional with a couple of quirky bits thrown in (the light sconces in the lounge!). Very friendly and helpful, low key staff. Room was well maintained, clean and pleasant. Breakfast was simple but excellent (and filling). Would definitely go back there if staying in Venice again.
